about.c: The subject matter of the content.

AcceptAction.c:
The act of committing to/adopting an object.

Related actions:

  • RejectAction: The antonym of AcceptAction.

acceptedAnswer.c: The answer that has been accepted as best, typically on a Question/Answer site. Sites vary in their selection mechanisms, e.g. drawing on community opinion and/or the view of the Question author.

acceptedOffer.c: The offer(s) -- e.g., product, quantity and price combinations -- included in the order.

acceptedPaymentMethod.c: The payment method(s) accepted by seller for this offer.

acceptsReservations.c: Indicates whether a FoodEstablishment accepts reservations. Values can be Boolean, an URL at which reservations can be made or (for backwards compatibility) the strings Yes or No.

accessCode.c: Password, PIN, or access code needed for delivery (e.g. from a locker).

accessibilityAPI.c: Indicates that the resource is compatible with the referenced accessibility API (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).

accessibilityControl.c: Identifies input methods that are sufficient to fully control the described resource (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).

accessibilityFeature.c: Content features of the resource, such as accessible media, alternatives and supported enhancements for accessibility (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).

accessibilityHazard.c: A characteristic of the described resource that is physiologically dangerous to some users. Related to WCAG 2.0 guideline 2.3 (WebSchemas wiki lists possible values).

accessibilitySummary.c: A human-readable summary of specific accessibility features or deficiencies, consistent with the other accessibility metadata but expressing subtleties such as "short descriptions are present but long descriptions will be needed for non-visual users" or "short descriptions are present and no long descriptions are needed."

accessMode.c: The human sensory perceptual system or cognitive faculty through which a person may process or perceive information. Expected values include: auditory, tactile, textual, visual, colorDependent, chartOnVisual, chemOnVisual, diagramOnVisual, mathOnVisual, musicOnVisual, textOnVisual.

accessModeSufficient.c: A list of single or combined accessModes that are sufficient to understand all the intellectual content of a resource. Expected values include:  auditory, tactile, textual, visual.

Accommodation.c:
An accommodation is a place that can accommodate human beings, e.g. a hotel room, a camping pitch, or a meeting room. Many accommodations are for overnight stays, but this is not a mandatory requirement. For more specific types of accommodations not defined in schema.org, one can use additionalType with external vocabularies.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

accountablePerson.c: Specifies the Person that is legally accountable for the CreativeWork.

accountId.c: The identifier for the account the payment will be applied to.

AccountingService.c:
Accountancy business.

As a LocalBusiness it can be described as a provider of one or more Service(s).

AchieveAction.c: The act of accomplishing something via previous efforts. It is an instantaneous action rather than an ongoing process.

acquiredFrom.c: The organization or person from which the product was acquired.

Action.c:
An action performed by a direct agent and indirect participants upon a direct object. Optionally happens at a location with the help of an inanimate instrument. The execution of the action may produce a result. Specific action sub-type documentation specifies the exact expectation of each argument/role.

See also blog post and Actions overview document.

actionApplication.c: An application that can complete the request.

actionOption.c: A sub property of object. The options subject to this action.

actionPlatform.c: The high level platform(s) where the Action can be performed for the given URL. To specify a specific application or operating system instance, use actionApplication.

actionStatus.c: Indicates the current disposition of the Action.

ActivateAction.c: The act of starting or activating a device or application (e.g. starting a timer or turning on a flashlight).

ActiveActionStatus.c: An in-progress action (e.g, while watching the movie, or driving to a location).

actor.c: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

actors.c: An actor, e.g. in tv, radio, movie, video games etc. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

AddAction.c: The act of editing by adding an object to a collection.

additionalName.c: An additional name for a Person, can be used for a middle name.

additionalNumberOfGuests.c: If responding yes, the number of guests who will attend in addition to the invitee.

additionalProperty.c:
A property-value pair representing an additional characteristics of the entitity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org.

Note: Publishers should be aware that applications designed to use specific schema.org properties (e.g. http://schema.org/width, http://schema.org/color, http://schema.org/gtin13, ...) will typically expect such data to be provided using those properties, rather than using the generic property/value mechanism.

additionalType.c: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

addOn.c: An additional offer that can only be obtained in combination with the first base offer (e.g. supplements and extensions that are available for a surcharge).

addressCountry.c: The country. For example, USA. You can also provide the two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.

addressLocality.c: The locality. For example, Mountain View.

AdministrativeArea.c: A geographical region, typically under the jurisdiction of a particular government.

advanceBookingRequirement.c: The amount of time that is required between accepting the offer and the actual usage of the resource or service.

affiliation.c: An organization that this person is affiliated with. For example, a school/university, a club, or a team.

afterMedia.c: A media object representing the circumstances after performing this direction.

agent.c: The direct performer or driver of the action (animate or inanimate). e.g. John wrote a book.

AggregateOffer.c: When a single product is associated with multiple offers (for example, the same pair of shoes is offered by different merchants), then AggregateOffer can be used.

aggregateRating.c: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

AggregateRating.c: The average rating based on multiple ratings or reviews.

AgreeAction.c: The act of expressing a consistency of opinion with the object. An agent agrees to/about an object (a proposition, topic or theme) with participants.

Airline.c: An organization that provides flights for passengers.

albumProductionType.c: Classification of the album by it's type of content: soundtrack, live album, studio album, etc.

albumReleaseType.c: The kind of release which this album is: single, EP or album.

AlignmentObject.c: An intangible item that describes an alignment between a learning resource and a node in an educational framework.

alignmentType.c: A category of alignment between the learning resource and the framework node. Recommended values include: 'assesses', 'teaches', 'requires', 'textComplexity', 'readingLevel', 'educationalSubject', and 'educationalLevel'.

AllocateAction.c: The act of organizing tasks/objects/events by associating resources to it.

AllWheelDriveConfiguration.c: All-wheel Drive is a transmission layout where the engine drives all four wheels.

alternativeHeadline.c: A secondary title of the CreativeWork.

alumniOf.c: An organization that the person is an alumni of.

amenityFeature.c: An amenity feature (e.g. a characteristic or service) of the Accommodation. This generic property does not make a statement about whether the feature is included in an offer for the main accommodation or available at extra costs.

amountOfThisGood.c: The quantity of the goods included in the offer.

annualPercentageRate.c: The annual rate that is charged for borrowing (or made by investing), expressed as a single percentage number that represents the actual yearly cost of funds over the term of a loan. This includes any fees or additional costs associated with the transaction.

Answer.c: An answer offered to a question; perhaps correct, perhaps opinionated or wrong.

answerCount.c: The number of answers this question has received.

Apartment.c: An apartment (in American English) or flat (in British English) is a self-contained housing unit (a type of residential real estate) that occupies only part of a building (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apartment).

APIReference.c: Reference documentation for application programming interfaces (APIs).

AppendAction.c: The act of inserting at the end if an ordered collection.

application.c: An application that can complete the request.

applicationCategory.c: Type of software application, e.g. 'Game, Multimedia'.

applicationSubCategory.c: Subcategory of the application, e.g. 'Arcade Game'.

applicationSuite.c: The name of the application suite to which the application belongs (e.g. Excel belongs to Office).

appliesToDeliveryMethod.c: The delivery method(s) to which the delivery charge or payment charge specification applies.

appliesToPaymentMethod.c: The payment method(s) to which the payment charge specification applies.

ApplyAction.c:
The act of registering to an organization/service without the guarantee to receive it.

Related actions:

  • RegisterAction: Unlike RegisterAction, ApplyAction has no guarantees that the application will be accepted.

area.c: The area within which users can expect to reach the broadcast service.

areaServed.c: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided.

arrivalAirport.c: The airport where the flight terminates.

arrivalBusStop.c: The stop or station from which the bus arrives.

arrivalGate.c: Identifier of the flight's arrival gate.

arrivalPlatform.c: The platform where the train arrives.

arrivalStation.c: The station where the train trip ends.

arrivalTerminal.c: Identifier of the flight's arrival terminal.

ArriveAction.c: The act of arriving at a place. An agent arrives at a destination from a fromLocation, optionally with participants.

artEdition.c: The number of copies when multiple copies of a piece of artwork are produced - e.g. for a limited edition of 20 prints, 'artEdition' refers to the total number of copies (in this example "20").

artform.c: e.g. Painting, Drawing, Sculpture, Print, Photograph, Assemblage, Collage, etc.

Article.c:
An article, such as a news article or piece of investigative report. Newspapers and magazines have articles of many different types and this is intended to cover them all.

See also blog post.

articleBody.c: The actual body of the article.

articleSection.c: Articles may belong to one or more 'sections' in a magazine or newspaper, such as Sports, Lifestyle, etc.

artMedium.c: The material used. (e.g. Oil, Watercolour, Acrylic, Linoprint, Marble, Cyanotype, Digital, Lithograph, DryPoint, Intaglio, Pastel, Woodcut, Pencil, Mixed Media, etc.)

artworkSurface.c: The supporting materials for the artwork, e.g. Canvas, Paper, Wood, Board, etc.

AskAction.c:
The act of posing a question / favor to someone.

Related actions:

  • ReplyAction: Appears generally as a response to AskAction.

assembly.c: Library file name e.g., mscorlib.dll, system.web.dll.

AssessAction.c: The act of forming one's opinion, reaction or sentiment.

AssignAction.c: The act of allocating an action/event/task to some destination (someone or something).

associatedArticle.c: A NewsArticle associated with the Media Object.

associatedMedia.c: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for encoding.

athlete.c: A person that acts as performing member of a sports team; a player as opposed to a coach.

attendee.c: A person or organization attending the event.

Attorney.c:
Professional service: Attorney.

This type is deprecated - LegalService is more inclusive and less ambiguous.

audience.c: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

Audience.c: Intended audience for an item, i.e. the group for whom the item was created.

audienceType.c: The target group associated with a given audience (e.g. veterans, car owners, musicians, etc.).

AudiobookFormat.c: Book format: Audiobook. This is an enumerated value for use with the bookFormat property. There is also a type 'Audiobook' in the bib extension which includes Audiobook specific properties.

author.c: The author of this content or rating. Please note that author is special in that HTML 5 provides a special mechanism for indicating authorship via the rel tag. That is equivalent to this and may be used interchangeably.

AuthorizeAction.c: The act of granting permission to an object.

availability.c: The availability of this item—for example In stock, Out of stock, Pre-order, etc.

availabilityEnds.c: The end of the availability of the product or service included in the offer.

availabilityStarts.c: The beginning of the availability of the product or service included in the offer.

availableAtOrFrom.c: The place(s) from which the offer can be obtained (e.g. store locations).

availableChannel.c: A means of accessing the service (e.g. a phone bank, a web site, a location, etc.).

availableDeliveryMethod.c: The delivery method(s) available for this offer.

availableFrom.c: When the item is available for pickup from the store, locker, etc.

availableLanguage.c: A language someone may use with or at the item, service or place. Please use one of the language codes from the IETF BCP 47 standard. See also inLanguage

availableOnDevice.c: Device required to run the application. Used in cases where a specific make/model is required to run the application.

availableThrough.c: After this date, the item will no longer be available for pickup.

award.c: An award won by or for this item.

awards.c: Awards won by or for this item.

awayTeam.c: The away team in a sports event.

BankAccount.c: A product or service offered by a bank whereby one may deposit, withdraw or transfer money and in some cases be paid interest.

Barcode.c: An image of a visual machine-readable code such as a barcode or QR code.

baseSalary.c: The base salary of the job or of an employee in an EmployeeRole.

bccRecipient.c: A sub property of recipient. The recipient blind copied on a message.

bed.c:
The type of bed or beds included in the accommodation. For the single case of just one bed of a certain type, you use bed directly with a text.
      If you want to indicate the quantity of a certain kind of bed, use an instance of BedDetails. For more detailed information, use the amenityFeature property.

BedAndBreakfast.c:
Bed and breakfast.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

BedDetails.c: An entity holding detailed information about the available bed types, e.g. the quantity of twin beds for a hotel room. For the single case of just one bed of a certain type, you can use bed directly with a text. See also BedType (under development).

beforeMedia.c: A media object representing the circumstances before performing this direction.

BefriendAction.c:
The act of forming a personal connection with someone (object) mutually/bidirectionally/symmetrically.

Related actions:

  • FollowAction: Unlike FollowAction, BefriendAction implies that the connection is reciprocal.

benefits.c: Description of benefits associated with the job.

bestRating.c: The highest value allowed in this rating system. If bestRating is omitted, 5 is assumed.

billingAddress.c: The billing address for the order.

billingIncrement.c: This property specifies the minimal quantity and rounding increment that will be the basis for the billing. The unit of measurement is specified by the unitCode property.

billingPeriod.c: The time interval used to compute the invoice.

birthPlace.c: The place where the person was born.

bitrate.c: The bitrate of the media object.

blogPost.c: A posting that is part of this blog.

blogPosts.c: The postings that are part of this blog.

boardingGroup.c: The airline-specific indicator of boarding order / preference.

boardingPolicy.c: The type of boarding policy used by the airline (e.g. zone-based or group-based).

BoardingPolicyType.c: A type of boarding policy used by an airline.

BodyOfWater.c: A body of water, such as a sea, ocean, or lake.

BookFormatType.c: The publication format of the book.

bookingAgent.c: 'bookingAgent' is an out-dated term indicating a 'broker' that serves as a booking agent.

bookingTime.c: The date and time the reservation was booked.

BookSeries.c: A series of books. Included books can be indicated with the hasPart property.

BorrowAction.c:
The act of obtaining an object under an agreement to return it at a later date. Reciprocal of LendAction.

Related actions:

  • LendAction: Reciprocal of BorrowAction.

borrower.c: A sub property of participant. The person that borrows the object being lent.

box.c: A box is the area enclosed by the rectangle formed by two points. The first point is the lower corner, the second point is the upper corner. A box is expressed as two points separated by a space character.

branchCode.c:
A short textual code (also called "store code") that uniquely identifies a place of business. The code is typically assigned by the parentOrganization and used in structured URLs.

For example, in the URL http://www.starbucks.co.uk/store-locator/etc/detail/3047 the code "3047" is a branchCode for a particular branch.

branchOf.c: The larger organization that this local business is a branch of, if any. Not to be confused with (anatomical)branch.

brand.c: The brand(s) associated with a product or service, or the brand(s) maintained by an organization or business person.

Brand.c: A brand is a name used by an organization or business person for labeling a product, product group, or similar.

breadcrumb.c: A set of links that can help a user understand and navigate a website hierarchy.

BreadcrumbList.c:
A BreadcrumbList is an ItemList consisting of a chain of linked Web pages, typically described using at least their URL and their name, and typically ending with the current page.

The position property is used to reconstruct the order of the items in a BreadcrumbList The convention is that a breadcrumb list has an itemListOrder of ItemListOrderAscending (lower values listed first), and that the first items in this list correspond to the "top" or beginning of the breadcrumb trail, e.g. with a site or section homepage. The specific values of 'position' are not assigned meaning for a BreadcrumbList, but they should be integers, e.g. beginning with '1' for the first item in the list.

broadcastAffiliateOf.c: The media network(s) whose content is broadcast on this station.

BroadcastChannel.c: A unique instance of a BroadcastService on a CableOrSatelliteService lineup.

broadcastChannelId.c: The unique address by which the BroadcastService can be identified in a provider lineup. In US, this is typically a number.

broadcastDisplayName.c: The name displayed in the channel guide. For many US affiliates, it is the network name.

broadcaster.c: The organization owning or operating the broadcast service.

BroadcastEvent.c: An over the air or online broadcast event.

broadcastOfEvent.c: The event being broadcast such as a sporting event or awards ceremony.

BroadcastService.c: A delivery service through which content is provided via broadcast over the air or online.

broadcastServiceTier.c: The type of service required to have access to the channel (e.g. Standard or Premium).

broadcastTimezone.c: The timezone in ISO 8601 format for which the service bases its broadcasts

broker.c: An entity that arranges for an exchange between a buyer and a seller.  In most cases a broker never acquires or releases ownership of a product or service involved in an exchange.  If it is not clear whether an entity is a broker, seller, or buyer, the latter two terms are preferred.

browserRequirements.c: Specifies browser requirements in human-readable text. For example, 'requires HTML5 support'.

BusinessAudience.c: A set of characteristics belonging to businesses, e.g. who compose an item's target audience.

BusinessEntityType.c:
A business entity type is a conceptual entity representing the legal form, the size, the main line of business, the position in the value chain, or any combination thereof, of an organization or business person.

Commonly used values:

  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Business
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Enduser
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PublicInstitution
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Reseller

businessFunction.c: The business function (e.g. sell, lease, repair, dispose) of the offer or component of a bundle (TypeAndQuantityNode). The default is http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell.

BusinessFunction.c:
The business function specifies the type of activity or access (i.e., the bundle of rights) offered by the organization or business person through the offer. Typical are sell, rental or lease, maintenance or repair, manufacture / produce, recycle / dispose, engineering / construction, or installation. Proprietary specifications of access rights are also instances of this class.

Commonly used values:

  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#ConstructionInstallation
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Dispose
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#LeaseOut
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Maintain
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#ProvideService
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Repair
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Buy

busName.c: The name of the bus (e.g. Bolt Express).

busNumber.c: The unique identifier for the bus.

BusReservation.c:
A reservation for bus travel.

Note: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use Offer.

BusTrip.c: A trip on a commercial bus line.

BuyAction.c: The act of giving money to a seller in exchange for goods or services rendered. An agent buys an object, product, or service from a seller for a price. Reciprocal of SellAction.

buyer.c: A sub property of participant. The participant/person/organization that bought the object.

byArtist.c: The artist that performed this album or recording.

CableOrSatelliteService.c: A service which provides access to media programming like TV or radio. Access may be via cable or satellite.

Campground.c:
A camping site, campsite, or campground is a place used for overnight stay in the outdoors. In British English a campsite is an area, usually divided into a number of pitches, where people can camp overnight using tents or camper vans or caravans; this British English use of the word is synonymous with the American English expression campground. In American English the term campsite generally means an area where an individual, family, group, or military unit can pitch a tent or parks a camper; a campground may contain many campsites (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Campsite).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

CampingPitch.c:
A camping pitch is an individual place for overnight stay in the outdoors, typically being part of a larger camping site.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

Canal.c: A canal, like the Panama Canal.

CancelAction.c:
The act of asserting that a future event/action is no longer going to happen.

Related actions:

  • ConfirmAction: The antonym of CancelAction.

candidate.c: A sub property of object. The candidate subject of this action.

Car.c: A car is a wheeled, self-powered motor vehicle used for transportation.

carbohydrateContent.c: The number of grams of carbohydrates.

cargoVolume.c:
The available volume for cargo or luggage. For automobiles, this is usually the trunk volume.

Typical unit code(s): LTR for liters, FTQ for cubic foot/feet

Note: You can use minValue and maxValue to indicate ranges.

carrier.c: 'carrier' is an out-dated term indicating the 'provider' for parcel delivery and flights.

carrierRequirements.c: Specifies specific carrier(s) requirements for the application (e.g. an application may only work on a specific carrier network).

catalog.c: A data catalog which contains this dataset.

catalogNumber.c: The catalog number for the release.

category.c: A category for the item. Greater signs or slashes can be used to informally indicate a category hierarchy.

ccRecipient.c: A sub property of recipient. The recipient copied on a message.

character.c: Fictional person connected with a creative work.

characterAttribute.c: A piece of data that represents a particular aspect of a fictional character (skill, power, character points, advantage, disadvantage).

characterName.c: The name of a character played in some acting or performing role, i.e. in a PerformanceRole.

CheckAction.c: An agent inspects, determines, investigates, inquires, or examines an object's accuracy, quality, condition, or state.

CheckInAction.c:
The act of an agent communicating (service provider, social media, etc) their arrival by registering/confirming for a previously reserved service (e.g. flight check in) or at a place (e.g. hotel), possibly resulting in a result (boarding pass, etc).

Related actions:

  • CheckOutAction: The antonym of CheckInAction.
  • ArriveAction: Unlike ArriveAction, CheckInAction implies that the agent is informing/confirming the start of a previously reserved service.
  • ConfirmAction: Unlike ConfirmAction, CheckInAction implies that the agent is informing/confirming the start of a previously reserved service rather than its validity/existence.

checkinTime.c: The earliest someone may check into a lodging establishment.

CheckOutAction.c:
The act of an agent communicating (service provider, social media, etc) their departure of a previously reserved service (e.g. flight check in) or place (e.g. hotel).

Related actions:

  • CheckInAction: The antonym of CheckOutAction.
  • DepartAction: Unlike DepartAction, CheckOutAction implies that the agent is informing/confirming the end of a previously reserved service.
  • CancelAction: Unlike CancelAction, CheckOutAction implies that the agent is informing/confirming the end of a previously reserved service.

checkoutTime.c: The latest someone may check out of a lodging establishment.

cholesterolContent.c: The number of milligrams of cholesterol.

ChooseAction.c: The act of expressing a preference from a set of options or a large or unbounded set of choices/options.

circle.c: A circle is the circular region of a specified radius centered at a specified latitude and longitude. A circle is expressed as a pair followed by a radius in meters.

citation.c: A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc.

CivicStructure.c: A public structure, such as a town hall or concert hall.

ClaimReview.c: A fact-checking review of claims made (or reported) in some creative work (referenced via itemReviewed).

claimReviewed.c: A short summary of the specific claims reviewed in a ClaimReview.

Clip.c: A short TV or radio program or a segment/part of a program.

clipNumber.c: Position of the clip within an ordered group of clips.

closes.c: The closing hour of the place or service on the given day(s) of the week.

coach.c: A person that acts in a coaching role for a sports team.

Code.c: Computer programming source code. Example: Full (compile ready) solutions, code snippet samples, scripts, templates.

codeRepository.c: Link to the repository where the un-compiled, human readable code and related code is located (SVN, github, CodePlex).

codeSampleType.c: What type of code sample: full (compile ready) solution, code snippet, inline code, scripts, template.

collection.c: A sub property of object. The collection target of the action.

CollegeOrUniversity.c: A college, university, or other third-level educational institution.

Comment.c: A comment on an item - for example, a comment on a blog post. The comment's content is expressed via the text property, and its topic via about, properties shared with all CreativeWorks.

CommentAction.c: The act of generating a comment about a subject.

commentCount.c: The number of comments this CreativeWork (e.g. Article, Question or Answer) has received. This is most applicable to works published in Web sites with commenting system; additional comments may exist elsewhere.

CommentPermission.c: Permission to add comments to the document.

commentTime.c: The time at which the UserComment was made.

CommunicateAction.c: The act of conveying information to another person via a communication medium (instrument) such as speech, email, or telephone conversation.

competitor.c: A competitor in a sports event.

CompletedActionStatus.c: An action that has already taken place.

composer.c: The person or organization who wrote a composition, or who is the composer of a work performed at some event.

CompoundPriceSpecification.c: A compound price specification is one that bundles multiple prices that all apply in combination for different dimensions of consumption. Use the name property of the attached unit price specification for indicating the dimension of a price component (e.g. "electricity" or "final cleaning").

ComputerLanguage.c: This type covers computer programming languages such as Scheme and Lisp, as well as other language-like computer representations. Natural languages are best represented with the Language type.

ConfirmAction.c:
The act of notifying someone that a future event/action is going to happen as expected.

Related actions:

  • CancelAction: The antonym of ConfirmAction.

confirmationNumber.c: A number that confirms the given order or payment has been received.

contactOption.c: An option available on this contact point (e.g. a toll-free number or support for hearing-impaired callers).

contactPoint.c: A contact point for a person or organization.

ContactPoint.c: A contact point—for example, a Customer Complaints department.

ContactPointOption.c: Enumerated options related to a ContactPoint.

contactPoints.c: A contact point for a person or organization.

contactType.c: A person or organization can have different contact points, for different purposes. For example, a sales contact point, a PR contact point and so on. This property is used to specify the kind of contact point.

containedIn.c: The basic containment relation between a place and one that contains it.

containedInPlace.c: The basic containment relation between a place and one that contains it.

containsPlace.c: The basic containment relation between a place and another that it contains.

containsSeason.c: A season that is part of the media series.

contentLocation.c: The location depicted or described in the content. For example, the location in a photograph or painting.

contentRating.c: Official rating of a piece of content—for example,'MPAA PG-13'.

contentType.c: The supported content type(s) for an EntryPoint response.

contentUrl.c: Actual bytes of the media object, for example the image file or video file.

Continent.c: One of the continents (for example, Europe or Africa).

contributor.c: A secondary contributor to the CreativeWork or Event.

ControlAction.c: An agent controls a device or application.

Conversation.c: One or more messages between organizations or people on a particular topic. Individual messages can be linked to the conversation with isPartOf or hasPart properties.

cookingMethod.c: The method of cooking, such as Frying, Steaming, ...

cookTime.c: The time it takes to actually cook the dish, in ISO 8601 duration format.

CoOp.c: Play mode: CoOp. Co-operative games, where you play on the same team with friends.

copyrightHolder.c: The party holding the legal copyright to the CreativeWork.

copyrightYear.c: The year during which the claimed copyright for the CreativeWork was first asserted.

countriesNotSupported.c: Countries for which the application is not supported. You can also provide the two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.

countriesSupported.c: Countries for which the application is supported. You can also provide the two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.

countryOfOrigin.c: The country of the principal offices of the production company or individual responsible for the movie or program.

course.c: A sub property of location. The course where this action was taken.

Course.c: A description of an educational course which may be offered as distinct instances at which take place at different times or take place at different locations, or be offered through different media or modes of study. An educational course is a sequence of one or more educational events and/or creative works which aims to build knowledge, competence or ability of learners.

courseCode.c: The identifier for the Course used by the course provider (e.g. CS101 or 6.001).

CourseInstance.c: An instance of a Course which is distinct from other instances because it is offered at a different time or location or through different media or modes of study or to a specific section of students.

courseMode.c: The medium or means of delivery of the course instance or the mode of study, either as a text label (e.g. "online", "onsite" or "blended"; "synchronous" or "asynchronous"; "full-time" or "part-time") or as a URL reference to a term from a controlled vocabulary (e.g. https://ceds.ed.gov/element/001311#Asynchronous ).

coursePrerequisites.c: Requirements for taking the Course. May be completion of another Course or a textual description like "permission of instructor". Requirements may be a pre-requisite competency, referenced using AlignmentObject.

coverageEndTime.c: The time when the live blog will stop covering the Event. Note that coverage may continue after the Event concludes.

coverageStartTime.c: The time when the live blog will begin covering the Event. Note that coverage may begin before the Event's start time. The LiveBlogPosting may also be created before coverage begins.

CreateAction.c: The act of deliberately creating/producing/generating/building a result out of the agent.

CreativeWork.c: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.

CreativeWorkSeason.c: A media season e.g. tv, radio, video game etc.

CreativeWorkSeries.c:
A CreativeWorkSeries in schema.org is a group of related items, typically but not necessarily of the same kind. CreativeWorkSeries are usually organized into some order, often chronological. Unlike ItemList which is a general purpose data structure for lists of things, the emphasis with CreativeWorkSeries is on published materials (written e.g. books and periodicals, or media such as tv, radio and games).

Specific subtypes are available for describing TVSeries, RadioSeries, MovieSeries, BookSeries, Periodical and VideoGameSeries. In each case, the hasPart / isPartOf properties can be used to relate the CreativeWorkSeries to its parts. The general CreativeWorkSeries type serves largely just to organize these more specific and practical subtypes.

It is common for properties applicable to an item from the series to be usefully applied to the containing group. Schema.org attempts to anticipate some of these cases, but publishers should be free to apply properties of the series parts to the series as a whole wherever they seem appropriate.

creator.c: The creator/author of this CreativeWork. This is the same as the Author property for CreativeWork.

CreditCard.c:
A card payment method of a particular brand or name. Used to mark up a particular payment method and/or the financial product/service that supplies the card account.

Commonly used values:

  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#AmericanExpress
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DinersClub
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Discover
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#JCB
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#MasterCard
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#VISA

creditedTo.c: The group the release is credited to if different than the byArtist. For example, Red and Blue is credited to "Stefani Germanotta Band", but by Lady Gaga.

currency.c: The currency in which the monetary amount is expressed (in 3-letter ISO 4217 format).

CurrencyConversionService.c: A service to convert funds from one currency to another currency.

customer.c: Party placing the order or paying the invoice.

DamagedCondition.c: Indicates that the item is damaged.

DanceGroup.c: A dance group—for example, the Alvin Ailey Dance Theater or Riverdance.

DataFeed.c: A single feed providing structured information about one or more entities or topics.

dataFeedElement.c: An item within in a data feed. Data feeds may have many elements.

DataFeedItem.c: A single item within a larger data feed.

dataset.c: A dataset contained in this catalog.

Dataset.c: A body of structured information describing some topic(s) of interest.

datasetTimeInterval.c: The range of temporal applicability of a dataset, e.g. for a 2011 census dataset, the year 2011 (in ISO 8601 time interval format).

DataType.c: The basic data types such as Integers, Strings, etc.

Date.c: A date value in ISO 8601 date format.

dateCreated.c: The date on which the CreativeWork was created or the item was added to a DataFeed.

dateDeleted.c: The datetime the item was removed from the DataFeed.

DatedMoneySpecification.c: A DatedMoneySpecification represents monetary values with optional start and end dates. For example, this could represent an employee's salary over a specific period of time. Note: This type has been superseded by MonetaryAmount use of that type is recommended

dateIssued.c: The date the ticket was issued.

dateline.c: A dateline is a brief piece of text included in news articles that describes where and when the story was written or filed though the date is often omitted. Sometimes only a placename is provided.

dateModified.c: The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed.

datePosted.c: Publication date for the job posting.

dateRead.c: The date/time at which the message has been read by the recipient if a single recipient exists.

dateReceived.c: The date/time the message was received if a single recipient exists.

dateSent.c: The date/time at which the message was sent.

DateTime.c: A combination of date and time of day in the form [-]CCYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm] (see Chapter 5.4 of ISO 8601).

dateVehicleFirstRegistered.c: The date of the first registration of the vehicle with the respective public authorities.

dayOfWeek.c: The day of the week for which these opening hours are valid.

DayOfWeek.c:
The day of the week, e.g. used to specify to which day the opening hours of an OpeningHoursSpecification refer.

Originally, URLs from GoodRelations were used (for Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, Sunday plus a special entry for PublicHolidays); these have now been integrated directly into schema.org.

DeactivateAction.c: The act of stopping or deactivating a device or application (e.g. stopping a timer or turning off a flashlight).

deathPlace.c: The place where the person died.

defaultValue.c: The default value of the input.  For properties that expect a literal, the default is a literal value, for properties that expect an object, it's an ID reference to one of the current values.

DefenceEstablishment.c: A defence establishment, such as an army or navy base.

DeleteAction.c: The act of editing a recipient by removing one of its objects.

DeliveryChargeSpecification.c: The price for the delivery of an offer using a particular delivery method.

DeliveryEvent.c: An event involving the delivery of an item.

deliveryLeadTime.c: The typical delay between the receipt of the order and the goods either leaving the warehouse or being prepared for pickup, in case the delivery method is on site pickup.

deliveryMethod.c: A sub property of instrument. The method of delivery.

DeliveryMethod.c:
A delivery method is a standardized procedure for transferring the product or service to the destination of fulfillment chosen by the customer. Delivery methods are characterized by the means of transportation used, and by the organization or group that is the contracting party for the sending organization or person.

Commonly used values:

  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DeliveryModeDirectDownload
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DeliveryModeFreight
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DeliveryModeMail
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DeliveryModeOwnFleet
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DeliveryModePickUp
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DHL
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#FederalExpress
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#UPS

deliveryStatus.c: New entry added as the package passes through each leg of its journey (from shipment to final delivery).

Demand.c: A demand entity represents the public, not necessarily binding, not necessarily exclusive, announcement by an organization or person to seek a certain type of goods or services. For describing demand using this type, the very same properties used for Offer apply.

DepartAction.c: The act of  departing from a place. An agent departs from an fromLocation for a destination, optionally with participants.

department.c: A relationship between an organization and a department of that organization, also described as an organization (allowing different urls, logos, opening hours). For example: a store with a pharmacy, or a bakery with a cafe.

departureAirport.c: The airport where the flight originates.

departureBusStop.c: The stop or station from which the bus departs.

departureGate.c: Identifier of the flight's departure gate.

departurePlatform.c: The platform from which the train departs.

departureStation.c: The station from which the train departs.

departureTerminal.c: Identifier of the flight's departure terminal.

dependencies.c: Prerequisites needed to fulfill steps in article.

DepositAccount.c: A type of Bank Account with a main purpose of depositing funds to gain interest or other benefits.

device.c: Device required to run the application. Used in cases where a specific make/model is required to run the application.

DiabeticDiet.c: A diet appropriate for people with diabetes.

DigitalDocumentPermission.c: A permission for a particular person or group to access a particular file.

DigitalDocumentPermissionType.c: A type of permission which can be granted for accessing a digital document.

director.c: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

directors.c: A director of e.g. tv, radio, movie, video games etc. content. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

DisagreeAction.c: The act of expressing a difference of opinion with the object. An agent disagrees to/about an object (a proposition, topic or theme) with participants.

disambiguatingDescription.c: A sub property of description. A short description of the item used to disambiguate from other, similar items. Information from other properties (in particular, name) may be necessary for the description to be useful for disambiguation.

Discontinued.c: Indicates that the item has been discontinued.

discountCode.c: Code used to redeem a discount.

discountCurrency.c: The currency (in 3-letter ISO 4217 format) of the discount.

DiscoverAction.c: The act of discovering/finding an object.

discusses.c: Specifies the CreativeWork associated with the UserComment.

DiscussionForumPosting.c: A posting to a discussion forum.

discussionUrl.c: A link to the page containing the comments of the CreativeWork.

DislikeAction.c: The act of expressing a negative sentiment about the object. An agent dislikes an object (a proposition, topic or theme) with participants.

dissolutionDate.c: The date that this organization was dissolved.

distance.c: The distance travelled, e.g. exercising or travelling.

Distance.c: Properties that take Distances as values are of the form '<Number> <Length unit of measure>'. E.g., '7 ft'.

distribution.c: A downloadable form of this dataset, at a specific location, in a specific format.

DonateAction.c: The act of providing goods, services, or money without compensation, often for philanthropic reasons.

DownloadAction.c: The act of downloading an object.

downloadUrl.c: If the file can be downloaded, URL to download the binary.

downvoteCount.c: The number of downvotes this question, answer or comment has received from the community.

DrawAction.c: The act of producing a visual/graphical representation of an object, typically with a pen/pencil and paper as instruments.

driveWheelConfiguration.c: The drive wheel configuration, i.e. which roadwheels will receive torque from the vehicle's engine via the drivetrain.

DriveWheelConfigurationValue.c: A value indicating which roadwheels will receive torque.

dropoffLocation.c: Where a rental car can be dropped off.

dropoffTime.c: When a rental car can be dropped off.

duns.c: The Dun & Bradstreet DUNS number for identifying an organization or business person.

duration.c: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in ISO 8601 date format.

durationOfWarranty.c: The duration of the warranty promise. Common unitCode values are ANN for year, MON for months, or DAY for days.

duringMedia.c: A media object representing the circumstances while performing this direction.

EatAction.c: The act of swallowing solid objects.

editor.c: Specifies the Person who edited the CreativeWork.

educationalAlignment.c: An alignment to an established educational framework.

educationalFramework.c: The framework to which the resource being described is aligned.

educationalUse.c: The purpose of a work in the context of education; for example, 'assignment', 'group work'.

educationRequirements.c: Educational background needed for the position.

eligibleCustomerType.c: The type(s) of customers for which the given offer is valid.

eligibleDuration.c: The duration for which the given offer is valid.

eligibleQuantity.c: The interval and unit of measurement of ordering quantities for which the offer or price specification is valid. This allows e.g. specifying that a certain freight charge is valid only for a certain quantity.

eligibleRegion.c:
The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is valid.

See also ineligibleRegion.

eligibleTransactionVolume.c: The transaction volume, in a monetary unit, for which the offer or price specification is valid, e.g. for indicating a minimal purchasing volume, to express free shipping above a certain order volume, or to limit the acceptance of credit cards to purchases to a certain minimal amount.

embedUrl.c: A URL pointing to a player for a specific video. In general, this is the information in the src element of an embed tag and should not be the same as the content of the loc tag.

EmergencyService.c: An emergency service, such as a fire station or ER.

EmployeeRole.c: A subclass of OrganizationRole used to describe employee relationships.

employmentType.c: Type of employment (e.g. full-time, part-time, contract, temporary, seasonal, internship).

encodesCreativeWork.c: The CreativeWork encoded by this media object.

encoding.c: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for associatedMedia.

encodings.c: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork.

encodingType.c: The supported encoding type(s) for an EntryPoint request.

endDate.c: The end date and time of the item (in ISO 8601 date format).

endorsee.c: A sub property of participant. The person/organization being supported.

endTime.c:
The endTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to end. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from January to December.

Note that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

Energy.c: Properties that take Energy as values are of the form '<Number> <Energy unit of measure>'.

EngineSpecification.c: Information about the engine of the vehicle. A vehicle can have multiple engines represented by multiple engine specification entities.

entertainmentBusiness.c: A sub property of location. The entertainment business where the action occurred.

EntryPoint.c: An entry point, within some Web-based protocol.

Enumeration.c: Lists or enumerationsfor example, a list of cuisines or music genres, etc.

episode.c: An episode of a tv, radio or game media within a series or season.

Episode.c: A media episode (e.g. TV, radio, video game) which can be part of a series or season.

episodeNumber.c: Position of the episode within an ordered group of episodes.

episodes.c: An episode of a TV/radio series or season.

equal.c: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is equal to the object.

error.c: For failed actions, more information on the cause of the failure.

estimatedCost.c: The estimated cost of the supply or supplies consumed when performing instructions.

estimatedFlightDuration.c: The estimated time the flight will take.

event.c: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action.

Event.c: An event happening at a certain time and location, such as a concert, lecture, or festival. Ticketing information may be added via the offers property. Repeated events may be structured as separate Event objects.

EventCancelled.c: The event has been cancelled. If the event has multiple startDate values, all are assumed to be cancelled. Either startDate or previousStartDate may be used to specify the event's cancelled date(s).

EventPostponed.c: The event has been postponed and no new date has been set. The event's previousStartDate should be set.

EventRescheduled.c: The event has been rescheduled. The event's previousStartDate should be set to the old date and the startDate should be set to the event's new date. (If the event has been rescheduled multiple times, the previousStartDate property may be repeated).

EventReservation.c:
A reservation for an event like a concert, sporting event, or lecture.

Note: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use Offer.

events.c: Upcoming or past events associated with this place or organization.

EventScheduled.c: The event is taking place or has taken place on the startDate as scheduled. Use of this value is optional, as it is assumed by default.

eventStatus.c: An eventStatus of an event represents its status; particularly useful when an event is cancelled or rescheduled.

EventStatusType.c: EventStatusType is an enumeration type whose instances represent several states that an Event may be in.

exampleOfWork.c: A creative work that this work is an example/instance/realization/derivation of.

executableLibraryName.c: Library file name e.g., mscorlib.dll, system.web.dll.

ExerciseAction.c: The act of participating in exertive activity for the purposes of improving health and fitness.

exerciseCourse.c: A sub property of location. The course where this action was taken.

ExhibitionEvent.c: Event type: Exhibition event, e.g. at a museum, library, archive, tradeshow, ...

expectedArrivalFrom.c: The earliest date the package may arrive.

expectedArrivalUntil.c: The latest date the package may arrive.

expectsAcceptanceOf.c: An Offer which must be accepted before the user can perform the Action. For example, the user may need to buy a movie before being able to watch it.

experienceRequirements.c: Description of skills and experience needed for the position.

expires.c: Date the content expires and is no longer useful or available. For example a VideoObject or NewsArticle whose availability or relevance is time-limited, or a ClaimReview fact check whose publisher wants to indicate that it may no longer be relevant (or helpful to highlight) after some date.

FailedActionStatus.c: An action that failed to complete. The action's error property and the HTTP return code contain more information about the failure.

familyName.c: Family name. In the U.S., the last name of an Person. This can be used along with givenName instead of the name property.

fatContent.c: The number of grams of fat.

featureList.c: Features or modules provided by this application (and possibly required by other applications).

feesAndCommissionsSpecification.c: Description of fees, commissions, and other terms applied either to a class of financial product, or by a financial service organization.

fiberContent.c: The number of grams of fiber.

fileFormat.c: Media type, typically MIME format (see IANA site) of the content e.g. application/zip of a SoftwareApplication binary. In cases where a CreativeWork has several media type representations, 'encoding' can be used to indicate each MediaObject alongside particular fileFormat information. Unregistered or niche file formats can be indicated instead via the most appropriate URL, e.g. defining Web page or a Wikipedia entry.

fileSize.c: Size of the application / package (e.g. 18MB). In the absence of a unit (MB, KB etc.), KB will be assumed.

FilmAction.c: The act of capturing sound and moving images on film, video, or digitally.

FinancialProduct.c: A product provided to consumers and businesses by financial institutions such as banks, insurance companies, brokerage firms, consumer finance companies, and investment companies which comprise the financial services industry.

FindAction.c:
The act of finding an object.

Related actions:

  • SearchAction: FindAction is generally lead by a SearchAction, but not necessarily.

firstPerformance.c: The date and place the work was first performed.

flightNumber.c: The unique identifier for a flight including the airline IATA code. For example, if describing United flight 110, where the IATA code for United is 'UA', the flightNumber is 'UA110'.

FlightReservation.c:
A reservation for air travel.

Note: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use Offer.

floorSize.c:
The size of the accommodation, e.g. in square meter or squarefoot.
Typical unit code(s): MTK for square meter, FTK for square foot, or YDK for square yard

FollowAction.c:
The act of forming a personal connection with someone/something (object) unidirectionally/asymmetrically to get updates polled from.

Related actions:

  • BefriendAction: Unlike BefriendAction, FollowAction implies that the connection is not necessarily reciprocal.
  • SubscribeAction: Unlike SubscribeAction, FollowAction implies that the follower acts as an active agent constantly/actively polling for updates.
  • RegisterAction: Unlike RegisterAction, FollowAction implies that the agent is interested in continuing receiving updates from the object.
  • JoinAction: Unlike JoinAction, FollowAction implies that the agent is interested in getting updates from the object.
  • TrackAction: Unlike TrackAction, FollowAction refers to the polling of updates of all aspects of animate objects rather than the location of inanimate objects (e.g. you track a package, but you don't follow it).

followee.c: A sub property of object. The person or organization being followed.

follows.c: The most generic uni-directional social relation.

foodEstablishment.c: A sub property of location. The specific food establishment where the action occurred.

FoodEstablishmentReservation.c: A reservation to dine at a food-related business.Note: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations.

foodEvent.c: A sub property of location. The specific food event where the action occurred.

FoodService.c: A food service, like breakfast, lunch, or dinner.

founder.c: A person who founded this organization.

founders.c: A person who founded this organization.

foundingDate.c: The date that this organization was founded.

foundingLocation.c: The place where the Organization was founded.

FourWheelDriveConfiguration.c: Four-wheel drive is a transmission layout where the engine primarily drives two wheels with a part-time four-wheel drive capability.

free.c: A flag to signal that the item, event, or place is accessible for free.

Friday.c: The day of the week between Thursday and Saturday.

fromLocation.c: A sub property of location. The original location of the object or the agent before the action.

FrontWheelDriveConfiguration.c: Front-wheel drive is a transmission layout where the engine drives the front wheels.

fuelConsumption.c:
The amount of fuel consumed for traveling a particular distance or temporal duration with the given vehicle (e.g. liters per 100 km).

  • Note 1: There are unfortunately no standard unit codes for liters per 100 km. Use unitText to indicate the unit of measurement, e.g. L/100 km.
  • Note 2: There are two ways of indicating the fuel consumption, fuelConsumption (e.g. 8 liters per 100 km) and fuelEfficiency (e.g. 30 miles per gallon). They are reciprocal.
  • Note 3: Often, the absolute value is useful only when related to driving speed ("at 80 km/h") or usage pattern ("city traffic"). You can use valueReference to link the value for the fuel consumption to another value.

fuelEfficiency.c:
The distance traveled per unit of fuel used; most commonly miles per gallon (mpg) or kilometers per liter (km/L).

  • Note 1: There are unfortunately no standard unit codes for miles per gallon or kilometers per liter. Use unitText to indicate the unit of measurement, e.g. mpg or km/L.
  • Note 2: There are two ways of indicating the fuel consumption, fuelConsumption (e.g. 8 liters per 100 km) and fuelEfficiency (e.g. 30 miles per gallon). They are reciprocal.
  • Note 3: Often, the absolute value is useful only when related to driving speed ("at 80 km/h") or usage pattern ("city traffic"). You can use valueReference to link the value for the fuel economy to another value.

fuelType.c: The type of fuel suitable for the engine or engines of the vehicle. If the vehicle has only one engine, this property can be attached directly to the vehicle.

funder.c: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

game.c: Video game which is played on this server.

Game.c: The Game type represents things which are games. These are typically rule-governed recreational activities, e.g. role-playing games in which players assume the role of characters in a fictional setting.

gameItem.c: An item is an object within the game world that can be collected by a player or, occasionally, a non-player character.

gameLocation.c: Real or fictional location of the game (or part of game).

gamePlatform.c: The electronic systems used to play video games.

GamePlayMode.c: Indicates whether this game is multi-player, co-op or single-player.

gameServer.c: The server on which  it is possible to play the game.

GameServer.c: Server that provides game interaction in a multiplayer game.

gender.c: Gender of the person. While http://schema.org/Male and http://schema.org/Female may be used, text strings are also acceptable for people who do not identify as a binary gender.

genre.c: Genre of the creative work, broadcast channel or group.

geo.c: The geo coordinates of the place.

GeoCircle.c:
A GeoCircle is a GeoShape representing a circular geographic area. As it is a GeoShape
          it provides the simple textual property 'circle', but also allows the combination of postalCode alongside geoRadius.
          The center of the circle can be indicated via the 'geoMidpoint' property, or more approximately using 'address', 'postalCode'.

GeoCoordinates.c: The geographic coordinates of a place or event.

geographicArea.c: The geographic area associated with the audience.

geoMidpoint.c: Indicates the GeoCoordinates at the centre of a GeoShape e.g. GeoCircle.

geoRadius.c: Indicates the approximate radius of a GeoCircle (metres unless indicated otherwise via Distance notation).

GeoShape.c: The geographic shape of a place. A GeoShape can be described using several properties whose values are based on latitude/longitude pairs. Either whitespace or commas can be used to separate latitude and longitude; whitespace should be used when writing a list of several such points.

GiveAction.c:
The act of transferring ownership of an object to a destination. Reciprocal of TakeAction.

Related actions:

  • TakeAction: Reciprocal of GiveAction.
  • SendAction: Unlike SendAction, GiveAction implies that ownership is being transferred (e.g. I may send my laptop to you, but that doesn't mean I'm giving it to you).

givenName.c: Given name. In the U.S., the first name of a Person. This can be used along with familyName instead of the name property.

globalLocationNumber.c: The Global Location Number (GLN, sometimes also referred to as International Location Number or ILN) of the respective organization, person, or place. The GLN is a 13-digit number used to identify parties and physical locations.

GovernmentOffice.c: A government office—for example, an IRS or DMV office.

GovernmentPermit.c: A permit issued by a government agency.

GovernmentService.c: A service provided by a government organization, e.g. food stamps, veterans benefits, etc.

grantee.c: The person, organization, contact point, or audience that has been granted this permission.

greater.c: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is greater than the object.

greaterOrEqual.c: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is greater than or equal to the object.

GroupBoardingPolicy.c: The airline boards by groups based on check-in time, priority, etc.

gtin12.c: The GTIN-12 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. The GTIN-12 is the 12-digit GS1 Identification Key composed of a U.P.C. Company Prefix, Item Reference, and Check Digit used to identify trade items. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.

gtin13.c: The GTIN-13 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This is equivalent to 13-digit ISBN codes and EAN UCC-13. Former 12-digit UPC codes can be converted into a GTIN-13 code by simply adding a preceeding zero. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.

gtin14.c: The GTIN-14 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.

gtin8.c: The GTIN-8 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This code is also known as EAN/UCC-8 or 8-digit EAN. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.

HalalDiet.c: A diet conforming to Islamic dietary practices.

hasCourseInstance.c: An offering of the course at a specific time and place or through specific media or mode of study or to a specific section of students.

hasDeliveryMethod.c: Method used for delivery or shipping.

hasDigitalDocumentPermission.c: A permission related to the access to this document (e.g. permission to read or write an electronic document). For a public document, specify a grantee with an Audience with audienceType equal to "public".

hasMap.c: A URL to a map of the place.

hasMenu.c: Either the actual menu as a structured representation, as text, or a URL of the menu.

hasMenuItem.c: A food or drink item contained in a menu or menu section.

hasMenuSection.c: A subgrouping of the menu (by dishes, course, serving time period, etc.).

hasOfferCatalog.c: Indicates an OfferCatalog listing for this Organization, Person, or Service.

hasPart.c: Indicates a CreativeWork that is (in some sense) a part of this CreativeWork.

hasPOS.c: Points-of-Sales operated by the organization or person.

HearingImpairedSupported.c: Uses devices to support users with hearing impairments.

highPrice.c: The highest price of all offers available.

HinduDiet.c: A diet conforming to Hindu dietary practices, in particular, beef-free.

HobbyShop.c: A store that sells materials useful or necessary for various hobbies.

HomeAndConstructionBusiness.c:
A construction business.

A HomeAndConstructionBusiness is a LocalBusiness that provides services around homes and buildings.

As a LocalBusiness it can be described as a provider of one or more Service(s).

homeLocation.c: A contact location for a person's residence.

homeTeam.c: The home team in a sports event.

honorificPrefix.c: An honorific prefix preceding a Person's name such as Dr/Mrs/Mr.

honorificSuffix.c: An honorific suffix preceding a Person's name such as M.D. /PhD/MSCSW.

Hostel.c:
A hostel - cheap accommodation, often in shared dormitories.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

hostingOrganization.c: The organization (airline, travelers' club, etc.) the membership is made with.

Hotel.c:
A hotel is an establishment that provides lodging paid on a short-term basis (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hotel).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

HotelRoom.c:
A hotel room is a single room in a hotel.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

hoursAvailable.c: The hours during which this service or contact is available.

House.c: A house is a building or structure that has the ability to be occupied for habitation by humans or other creatures (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House).

HowTo.c: Instructions that explain how to achieve a result by performing a sequence of steps.

HowToDirection.c: A direction indicating a single action to do in the instructions for how to achieve a result.

HowToItem.c: An item used as either a tool or supply when performing the instructions for how to to achieve a result.

HowToSection.c: A sub-grouping of steps in the instructions for how to achieve a result (e.g. steps for making a pie crust within a pie recipe).

HowToStep.c: A step in the instructions for how to achieve a result. It is an ordered list with HowToDirection and/or HowToTip items.

HowToSupply.c: A supply consumed when performing the instructions for how to achieve a result.

HowToTip.c: An explanation in the instructions for how to achieve a result. It provides supplementary information about a technique, supply, author's preference, etc. It can explain what could be done, or what should not be done, but doesn't specify what should be done (see HowToDirection).

HowToTool.c: A tool used (but not consumed) when performing instructions for how to achieve a result.

httpMethod.c: An HTTP method that specifies the appropriate HTTP method for a request to an HTTP EntryPoint. Values are capitalized strings as used in HTTP.

HVACBusiness.c: A business that provide Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning services.

iataCode.c: IATA identifier for an airline or airport.

identifier.c: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See background notes for more details.

IgnoreAction.c: The act of intentionally disregarding the object. An agent ignores an object.

image.c: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

ImageGallery.c: Web page type: Image gallery page.

inAlbum.c: The album to which this recording belongs.

incentiveCompensation.c: Description of bonus and commission compensation aspects of the job.

incentives.c: Description of bonus and commission compensation aspects of the job.

includedComposition.c: Smaller compositions included in this work (e.g. a movement in a symphony).

includedDataCatalog.c: A data catalog which contains this dataset (this property was previously 'catalog', preferred name is now 'includedInDataCatalog').

includedInDataCatalog.c: A data catalog which contains this dataset.

includesObject.c: This links to a node or nodes indicating the exact quantity of the products included in the offer.

IndividualProduct.c: A single, identifiable product instance (e.g. a laptop with a particular serial number).

industry.c: The industry associated with the job position.

ineligibleRegion.c:
The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is not valid, e.g. a region where the transaction is not allowed.

See also eligibleRegion.

InformAction.c: The act of notifying someone of information pertinent to them, with no expectation of a response.

ingredients.c: A single ingredient used in the recipe, e.g. sugar, flour or garlic.

inLanguage.c: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the IETF BCP 47 standard. See also availableLanguage.

inPlaylist.c: The playlist to which this recording belongs.

InsertAction.c: The act of adding at a specific location in an ordered collection.

InstallAction.c: The act of installing an application.

installUrl.c: URL at which the app may be installed, if different from the URL of the item.

InStock.c: Indicates that the item is in stock.

InStoreOnly.c: Indicates that the item is available only at physical locations.

instructor.c: A person assigned to instruct or provide instructional assistance for the CourseInstance.

instrument.c: The object that helped the agent perform the action. e.g. John wrote a book with a pen.

Intangible.c: A utility class that serves as the umbrella for a number of 'intangible' things such as quantities, structured values, etc.

InteractAction.c: The act of interacting with another person or organization.

interactionCount.c: This property is deprecated, alongside the UserInteraction types on which it depended.

InteractionCounter.c: A summary of how users have interacted with this CreativeWork. In most cases, authors will use a subtype to specify the specific type of interaction.

interactionService.c: The WebSite or SoftwareApplication where the interactions took place.

interactionStatistic.c: The number of interactions for the CreativeWork using the WebSite or SoftwareApplication. The most specific child type of InteractionCounter should be used.

interactionType.c: The Action representing the type of interaction. For up votes, +1s, etc. use LikeAction. For down votes use DislikeAction. Otherwise, use the most specific Action.

interactivityType.c: The predominant mode of learning supported by the learning resource. Acceptable values are 'active', 'expositive', or 'mixed'.

interestRate.c: The interest rate, charged or paid, applicable to the financial product. Note: This is different from the calculated annualPercentageRate.

inventoryLevel.c: The current approximate inventory level for the item or items.

InvestmentOrDeposit.c: A type of financial product that typically requires the client to transfer funds to a financial service in return for potential beneficial financial return.

InviteAction.c: The act of asking someone to attend an event. Reciprocal of RsvpAction.

Invoice.c: A statement of the money due for goods or services; a bill.

isAccessibleForFree.c: A flag to signal that the item, event, or place is accessible for free.

isAccessoryOrSparePartFor.c: A pointer to another product (or multiple products) for which this product is an accessory or spare part.

isBasedOn.c: A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html.

isBasedOnUrl.c: A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html.

isConsumableFor.c: A pointer to another product (or multiple products) for which this product is a consumable.

isFamilyFriendly.c: Indicates whether this content is family friendly.

isGift.c: Was the offer accepted as a gift for someone other than the buyer.

isicV4.c: The International Standard of Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC), Revision 4 code for a particular organization, business person, or place.

isLiveBroadcast.c: True is the broadcast is of a live event.

isPartOf.c: Indicates a CreativeWork that this CreativeWork is (in some sense) part of.

isrcCode.c: The International Standard Recording Code for the recording.

isRelatedTo.c: A pointer to another, somehow related product (or multiple products).

isSimilarTo.c: A pointer to another, functionally similar product (or multiple products).

issn.c: The International Standard Serial Number (ISSN) that identifies this serial publication. You can repeat this property to identify different formats of, or the linking ISSN (ISSN-L) for, this serial publication.

issuedBy.c: The organization issuing the ticket or permit.

issuedThrough.c: The service through with the permit was granted.

issueNumber.c: Identifies the issue of publication; for example, "iii" or "2".

isVariantOf.c: A pointer to a base product from which this product is a variant. It is safe to infer that the variant inherits all product features from the base model, unless defined locally. This is not transitive.

iswcCode.c: The International Standard Musical Work Code for the composition.

item.c: An entity represented by an entry in a list or data feed (e.g. an 'artist' in a list of 'artists').

ItemAvailability.c: A list of possible product availability options.

itemCondition.c: A predefined value from OfferItemCondition or a textual description of the condition of the product or service, or the products or services included in the offer.

ItemList.c: A list of items of any sort—for example, Top 10 Movies About Weathermen, or Top 100 Party Songs. Not to be confused with HTML lists, which are often used only for formatting.

itemListElement.c:
For itemListElement values, you can use simple strings (e.g. "Peter", "Paul", "Mary"), existing entities, or use ListItem.

Text values are best if the elements in the list are plain strings. Existing entities are best for a simple, unordered list of existing things in your data. ListItem is used with ordered lists when you want to provide additional context about the element in that list or when the same item might be in different places in different lists.

Note: The order of elements in your mark-up is not sufficient for indicating the order or elements. Use ListItem with a 'position' property in such cases.

itemListOrder.c: Type of ordering (e.g. Ascending, Descending, Unordered).

ItemListOrderAscending.c: An ItemList ordered with lower values listed first.

ItemListOrderDescending.c: An ItemList ordered with higher values listed first.

ItemListOrderType.c: Enumerated for values for itemListOrder for indicating how an ordered ItemList is organized.

ItemListUnordered.c: An ItemList ordered with no explicit order.

ItemPage.c: A page devoted to a single item, such as a particular product or hotel.

itemReviewed.c: The item that is being reviewed/rated.

jobBenefits.c: Description of benefits associated with the job.

jobLocation.c: A (typically single) geographic location associated with the job position.

JobPosting.c: A listing that describes a job opening in a certain organization.

jobTitle.c: The job title of the person (for example, Financial Manager).

JoinAction.c:
An agent joins an event/group with participants/friends at a location.

Related actions:

  • RegisterAction: Unlike RegisterAction, JoinAction refers to joining a group/team of people.
  • SubscribeAction: Unlike SubscribeAction, JoinAction does not imply that you'll be receiving updates.
  • FollowAction: Unlike FollowAction, JoinAction does not imply that you'll be polling for updates.

keywords.c: Keywords or tags used to describe this content. Multiple entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas.

knownVehicleDamages.c: A textual description of known damages, both repaired and unrepaired.

knows.c: The most generic bi-directional social/work relation.

KosherDiet.c: A diet conforming to Jewish dietary practices.

Landform.c: A landform or physical feature.  Landform elements include mountains, plains, lakes, rivers, seascape and oceanic waterbody interface features such as bays, peninsulas, seas and so forth, including sub-aqueous terrain features such as submersed mountain ranges, volcanoes, and the great ocean basins.

landlord.c: A sub property of participant. The owner of the real estate property.

language.c: A sub property of instrument. The language used on this action.

Language.c: Natural languages such as Spanish, Tamil, Hindi, English, etc. Formal language code tags expressed in BCP 47 can be used via the alternateName property. The Language type previously also covered programming languages such as Scheme and Lisp, which are now best represented using ComputerLanguage.

lastReviewed.c: Date on which the content on this web page was last reviewed for accuracy and/or completeness.

latitude.c: The latitude of a location. For example 37.42242 (WGS 84).

learningResourceType.c: The predominant type or kind characterizing the learning resource. For example, 'presentation', 'handout'.

LeaveAction.c:
An agent leaves an event / group with participants/friends at a location.

Related actions:

  • JoinAction: The antonym of LeaveAction.
  • UnRegisterAction: Unlike UnRegisterAction, LeaveAction implies leaving a group/team of people rather than a service.

LeftHandDriving.c: The steering position is on the left side of the vehicle (viewed from the main direction of driving).

legalName.c: The official name of the organization, e.g. the registered company name.

LegalService.c:
A LegalService is a business that provides legally-oriented services, advice and representation, e.g. law firms.

As a LocalBusiness it can be described as a provider of one or more Service(s).

LegislativeBuilding.c: A legislative building—for example, the state capitol.

leiCode.c: An organization identifier that uniquely identifies a legal entity as defined in ISO 17442.

LendAction.c:
