The act of providing an object under an agreement that it will be returned at a later date. Reciprocal of BorrowAction.

Related actions:

  • BorrowAction: Reciprocal of LendAction.

lender.c: A sub property of participant. The person that lends the object being borrowed.

lesser.c: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is lesser than the object.

lesserOrEqual.c: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is lesser than or equal to the object.

license.c: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.

LikeAction.c: The act of expressing a positive sentiment about the object. An agent likes an object (a proposition, topic or theme) with participants.

LimitedAvailability.c: Indicates that the item has limited availability.

line.c: A line is a point-to-point path consisting of two or more points. A line is expressed as a series of two or more point objects separated by space.

LiquorStore.c: A shop that sells alcoholic drinks such as wine, beer, whisky and other spirits.

ListenAction.c: The act of consuming audio content.

ListItem.c: An list item, e.g. a step in a checklist or how-to description.

LiveBlogPosting.c: A blog post intended to provide a rolling textual coverage of an ongoing event through continuous updates.

LoanOrCredit.c: A financial product for the loaning of an amount of money under agreed terms and charges.

loanTerm.c: The duration of the loan or credit agreement.

LocalBusiness.c: A particular physical business or branch of an organization. Examples of LocalBusiness include a restaurant, a particular branch of a restaurant chain, a branch of a bank, a medical practice, a club, a bowling alley, etc.

location.c: The location of for example where the event is happening, an organization is located, or where an action takes place.

locationCreated.c: The location where the CreativeWork was created, which may not be the same as the location depicted in the CreativeWork.

LocationFeatureSpecification.c: Specifies a location feature by providing a structured value representing a feature of an accommodation as a property-value pair of varying degrees of formality.

LockerDelivery.c: A DeliveryMethod in which an item is made available via locker.

LodgingBusiness.c: A lodging business, such as a motel, hotel, or inn.

LodgingReservation.c:
A reservation for lodging at a hotel, motel, inn, etc.

Note: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations.

lodgingUnitDescription.c: A full description of the lodging unit.

lodgingUnitType.c: Textual description of the unit type (including suite vs. room, size of bed, etc.).

longitude.c: The longitude of a location. For example -122.08585 (WGS 84).

LoseAction.c: The act of being defeated in a competitive activity.

loser.c: A sub property of participant. The loser of the action.

LowCalorieDiet.c: A diet focused on reduced calorie intake.

LowFatDiet.c: A diet focused on reduced fat and cholesterol intake.

LowLactoseDiet.c: A diet appropriate for people with lactose intolerance.

lowPrice.c: The lowest price of all offers available.

LowSaltDiet.c: A diet focused on reduced sodium intake.

lyricist.c: The person who wrote the words.

mainContentOfPage.c: Indicates if this web page element is the main subject of the page.

mainEntity.c: Indicates the primary entity described in some page or other CreativeWork.

mainEntityOfPage.c: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described. See background notes for details.

makesOffer.c: A pointer to products or services offered by the organization or person.

map.c: A URL to a map of the place.

MapCategoryType.c: An enumeration of several kinds of Map.

maps.c: A URL to a map of the place.

mapType.c: Indicates the kind of Map, from the MapCategoryType Enumeration.

MarryAction.c: The act of marrying a person.

Mass.c: Properties that take Mass as values are of the form '<Number> <Mass unit of measure>'. E.g., '7 kg'.

material.c: A material that something is made from, e.g. leather, wool, cotton, paper.

maximumAttendeeCapacity.c: The total number of individuals that may attend an event or venue.

maxPrice.c: The highest price if the price is a range.

maxValue.c: The upper value of some characteristic or property.

mealService.c: Description of the meals that will be provided or available for purchase.

MediaObject.c: A media object, such as an image, video, or audio object embedded in a web page or a downloadable dataset i.e. DataDownload. Note that a creative work may have many media objects associated with it on the same web page. For example, a page about a single song (MusicRecording) may have a music video (VideoObject), and a high and low bandwidth audio stream (2 AudioObject's).

MedicalOrganization.c: A medical organization (physical or not), such as hospital, institution or clinic.

MeetingRoom.c:
A meeting room, conference room, or conference hall is a room provided for singular events such as business conferences and meetings (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conference_hall).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

member.c: A member of an Organization or a ProgramMembership. Organizations can be members of organizations; ProgramMembership is typically for individuals.

memberOf.c: An Organization (or ProgramMembership) to which this Person or Organization belongs.

membershipNumber.c: A unique identifier for the membership.

mentions.c: Indicates that the CreativeWork contains a reference to, but is not necessarily about a concept.

menu.c: Either the actual menu as a structured representation, as text, or a URL of the menu.

Menu.c: A structured representation of food or drink items available from a FoodEstablishment.

MenuItem.c: A food or drink item listed in a menu or menu section.

MenuSection.c: A sub-grouping of food or drink items in a menu. E.g. courses (such as 'Dinner', 'Breakfast', etc.), specific type of dishes (such as 'Meat', 'Vegan', 'Drinks', etc.), or some other classification made by the menu provider.

Message.c: A single message from a sender to one or more organizations or people.

messageAttachment.c: A CreativeWork attached to the message.

MiddleSchool.c: A middle school (typically for children aged around 11-14, although this varies somewhat).

mileageFromOdometer.c:
The total distance travelled by the particular vehicle since its initial production, as read from its odometer.

Typical unit code(s): KMT for kilometers, SMI for statute miles

minimumPaymentDue.c: The minimum payment required at this time.

minPrice.c: The lowest price if the price is a range.

minValue.c: The lower value of some characteristic or property.

MobileApplication.c: A software application designed specifically to work well on a mobile device such as a telephone.

MobilePhoneStore.c: A store that sells mobile phones and related accessories.

model.c: The model of the product. Use with the URL of a ProductModel or a textual representation of the model identifier. The URL of the ProductModel can be from an external source. It is recommended to additionally provide strong product identifiers via the gtin8/gtin13/gtin14 and mpn properties.

modifiedTime.c: The date and time the reservation was modified.

Monday.c: The day of the week between Sunday and Tuesday.

MonetaryAmount.c: A monetary value or range. This type can be used to describe an amount of money such as $50 USD, or a range as in describing a bank account being suitable for a balance between 1,000 and 1,000,000 GBP, or the value of a salary, etc. It is recommended to use PriceSpecification Types to describe the price of an Offer, Invoice, etc.

Motel.c:
A motel.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

Mountain.c: A mountain, like Mount Whitney or Mount Everest.

MoveAction.c:
The act of an agent relocating to a place.

Related actions:

  • TransferAction: Unlike TransferAction, the subject of the move is a living Person or Organization rather than an inanimate object.

MovieClip.c: A short segment/part of a movie.

MovieSeries.c: A series of movies. Included movies can be indicated with the hasPart property.

mpn.c: The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) of the product, or the product to which the offer refers.

MultiPlayer.c: Play mode: MultiPlayer. Requiring or allowing multiple human players to play simultaneously.

multipleValues.c: Whether multiple values are allowed for the property.  Default is false.

MusicAlbumProductionType.c: Classification of the album by it's type of content: soundtrack, live album, studio album, etc.

MusicAlbumReleaseType.c: The kind of release which this album is: single, EP or album.

musicalKey.c: The key, mode, or scale this composition uses.

musicArrangement.c: An arrangement derived from the composition.

musicCompositionForm.c: The type of composition (e.g. overture, sonata, symphony, etc.).

MusicGroup.c: A musical group, such as a band, an orchestra, or a choir. Can also be a solo musician.

musicGroupMember.c: A member of a music group—for example, John, Paul, George, or Ringo.

MusicPlaylist.c: A collection of music tracks in playlist form.

MusicRecording.c: A music recording (track), usually a single song.

MusicRelease.c: A MusicRelease is a specific release of a music album.

musicReleaseFormat.c: Format of this release (the type of recording media used, ie. compact disc, digital media, LP, etc.).

MusicReleaseFormatType.c: Format of this release (the type of recording media used, ie. compact disc, digital media, LP, etc.).

naics.c: The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for a particular organization or business person.

namedPosition.c: A position played, performed or filled by a person or organization, as part of an organization. For example, an athlete in a SportsTeam might play in the position named 'Quarterback'.

netWorth.c: The total financial value of the person as calculated by subtracting assets from liabilities.

NewCondition.c: Indicates that the item is new.

NewsArticle.c:
A NewsArticle is an article whose content reports news, or provides background context and supporting materials for understanding the news.

A more detailed overview of schema.org News markup is also available.

nextItem.c: A link to the ListItem that follows the current one.

nonEqual.c: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is not equal to the object.

NoteDigitalDocument.c: A file containing a note, primarily for the author.

numAdults.c: The number of adults staying in the unit.

numberedPosition.c: A number associated with a role in an organization, for example, the number on an athlete's jersey.

numberOfAirbags.c: The number or type of airbags in the vehicle.

numberOfAxles.c:
The number of axles.

Typical unit code(s): C62

numberOfBeds.c: The quantity of the given bed type available in the HotelRoom, Suite, House, or Apartment.

numberOfDoors.c:
The number of doors.

Typical unit code(s): C62

numberOfEmployees.c: The number of employees in an organization e.g. business.

numberOfEpisodes.c: The number of episodes in this season or series.

numberOfForwardGears.c:
The total number of forward gears available for the transmission system of the vehicle.

Typical unit code(s): C62

numberOfItems.c: The number of items in an ItemList. Note that some descriptions might not fully describe all items in a list (e.g., multi-page pagination); in such cases, the numberOfItems would be for the entire list.

numberOfPages.c: The number of pages in the book.

numberOfPlayers.c: Indicate how many people can play this game (minimum, maximum, or range).

numberOfPreviousOwners.c:
The number of owners of the vehicle, including the current one.

Typical unit code(s): C62

numberOfRooms.c:
The number of rooms (excluding bathrooms and closets) of the acccommodation or lodging business.
Typical unit code(s): ROM for room or C62 for no unit. The type of room can be put in the unitText property of the QuantitativeValue.

numberOfSeasons.c: The number of seasons in this series.

numChildren.c: The number of children staying in the unit.

numTracks.c: The number of tracks in this album or playlist.

nutrition.c: Nutrition information about the recipe or menu item.

object.c: The object upon which the action is carried out, whose state is kept intact or changed. Also known as the semantic roles patient, affected or undergoer (which change their state) or theme (which doesn't). e.g. John read a book.

occupancy.c:
The allowed total occupancy for the accommodation in persons (including infants etc). For individual accommodations, this is not necessarily the legal maximum but defines the permitted usage as per the contractual agreement (e.g. a double room used by a single person).
Typical unit code(s): C62 for person

occupationalCategory.c: Category or categories describing the job. Use BLS O*NET-SOC taxonomy: http://www.onetcenter.org/taxonomy.html. Ideally includes textual label and formal code, with the property repeated for each applicable value.

Offer.c:
An offer to transfer some rights to an item or to provide a service for example, an offer to sell tickets to an event, to rent the DVD of a movie, to stream a TV show over the internet, to repair a motorcycle, or to loan a book.

For GTIN-related fields, see Check Digit calculator and validation guide from GS1.

OfferCatalog.c: An OfferCatalog is an ItemList that contains related Offers and/or further OfferCatalogs that are offeredBy the same provider.

offerCount.c: The number of offers for the product.

offeredBy.c: A pointer to the organization or person making the offer.

OfferItemCondition.c: A list of possible conditions for the item.

offers.c: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event.

OfflinePermanently.c: Game server status: OfflinePermanently. Server is offline and not available.

OfflineTemporarily.c: Game server status: OfflineTemporarily. Server is offline now but it can be online soon.

OnDemandEvent.c: A publication event e.g. catch-up TV or radio podcast, during which a program is available on-demand.

Online.c: Game server status: Online. Server is available.

OnlineFull.c: Game server status: OnlineFull. Server is online but unavailable. The maximum number of players has reached.

OnlineOnly.c: Indicates that the item is available only online.

OnSitePickup.c: A DeliveryMethod in which an item is collected on site, e.g. in a store or at a box office.

openingHours.c:
The general opening hours for a business. Opening hours can be specified as a weekly time range, starting with days, then times per day. Multiple days can be listed with commas ',' separating each day. Day or time ranges are specified using a hyphen '-'.

  • Days are specified using the following two-letter combinations: Mo, Tu, We, Th, Fr, Sa, Su.
  • Times are specified using 24:00 time. For example, 3pm is specified as 15:00.
  • Here is an example: <time itemprop="openingHours" datetime="Tu,Th 16:00-20:00">Tuesdays and Thursdays 4-8pm</time>.
  • If a business is open 7 days a week, then it can be specified as <time itemprop="openingHours" datetime="Mo-Su">Monday through Sunday, all day</time>.

openingHoursSpecification.c: The opening hours of a certain place.

OpeningHoursSpecification.c:
A structured value providing information about the opening hours of a place or a certain service inside a place.

The place is open if the opens property is specified, and closed otherwise.

If the value for the closes property is less than the value for the opens property then the hour range is assumed to span over the next day.

opens.c: The opening hour of the place or service on the given day(s) of the week.

opponent.c: A sub property of participant. The opponent on this action.

option.c: A sub property of object. The options subject to this action.

Order.c: An order is a confirmation of a transaction (a receipt), which can contain multiple line items, each represented by an Offer that has been accepted by the customer.

OrderAction.c: An agent orders an object/product/service to be delivered/sent.

OrderCancelled.c: OrderStatus representing cancellation of an order.

OrderDelivered.c: OrderStatus representing successful delivery of an order.

orderDelivery.c: The delivery of the parcel related to this order or order item.

OrderInTransit.c: OrderStatus representing that an order is in transit.

OrderItem.c: An order item is a line of an order. It includes the quantity and shipping details of a bought offer.

orderItemNumber.c: The identifier of the order item.

orderItemStatus.c: The current status of the order item.

OrderPaymentDue.c: OrderStatus representing that payment is due on an order.

OrderPickupAvailable.c: OrderStatus representing availability of an order for pickup.

OrderProblem.c: OrderStatus representing that there is a problem with the order.

OrderProcessing.c: OrderStatus representing that an order is being processed.

orderQuantity.c: The number of the item ordered. If the property is not set, assume the quantity is one.

OrderReturned.c: OrderStatus representing that an order has been returned.

orderStatus.c: The current status of the order.

Organization.c: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc.

OrganizationRole.c: A subclass of Role used to describe roles within organizations.

OrganizeAction.c: The act of manipulating/administering/supervising/controlling one or more objects.

OutOfStock.c: Indicates that the item is out of stock.

ownedFrom.c: The date and time of obtaining the product.

ownedThrough.c: The date and time of giving up ownership on the product.

OwnershipInfo.c: A structured value providing information about when a certain organization or person owned a certain product.

owns.c: Products owned by the organization or person.

pageEnd.c: The page on which the work ends; for example "138" or "xvi".

pageStart.c: The page on which the work starts; for example "135" or "xiii".

pagination.c: Any description of pages that is not separated into pageStart and pageEnd; for example, "1-6, 9, 55" or "10-12, 46-49".

PaintAction.c: The act of producing a painting, typically with paint and canvas as instruments.

ParcelDelivery.c: The delivery of a parcel either via the postal service or a commercial service.

ParcelService.c:
A private parcel service as the delivery mode available for a certain offer.

Commonly used values:

  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DHL
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#FederalExpress
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#UPS

ParentAudience.c: A set of characteristics describing parents, who can be interested in viewing some content.

parentItem.c: The parent of a question, answer or item in general.

parentOrganization.c: The larger organization that this organization is a subOrganization of, if any.

parentService.c: A broadcast service to which the broadcast service may belong to such as regional variations of a national channel.

ParkingFacility.c: A parking lot or other parking facility.

participant.c: Other co-agents that participated in the action indirectly. e.g. John wrote a book with Steve.

partOfEpisode.c: The episode to which this clip belongs.

partOfInvoice.c: The order is being paid as part of the referenced Invoice.

partOfOrder.c: The overall order the items in this delivery were included in.

partOfSeason.c: The season to which this episode belongs.

partOfSeries.c: The series to which this episode or season belongs.

partOfTVSeries.c: The TV series to which this episode or season belongs.

partySize.c: Number of people the reservation should accommodate.

passengerPriorityStatus.c: The priority status assigned to a passenger for security or boarding (e.g. FastTrack or Priority).

passengerSequenceNumber.c: The passenger's sequence number as assigned by the airline.

PawnShop.c: A shop that will buy, or lend money against the security of, personal possessions.

PayAction.c: An agent pays a price to a participant.

PaymentAutomaticallyApplied.c: An automatic payment system is in place and will be used.

PaymentCard.c: A payment method using a credit, debit, store or other card to associate the payment with an account.

PaymentChargeSpecification.c: The costs of settling the payment using a particular payment method.

PaymentComplete.c: The payment has been received and processed.

PaymentDeclined.c: The payee received the payment, but it was declined for some reason.

paymentDue.c: The date that payment is due.

PaymentDue.c: The payment is due, but still within an acceptable time to be received.

paymentDueDate.c: The date that payment is due.

paymentMethod.c: The name of the credit card or other method of payment for the order.

PaymentMethod.c:
A payment method is a standardized procedure for transferring the monetary amount for a purchase. Payment methods are characterized by the legal and technical structures used, and by the organization or group carrying out the transaction.

Commonly used values:

  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#ByBankTransferInAdvance
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#ByInvoice
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Cash
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#CheckInAdvance
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#COD
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DirectDebit
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#GoogleCheckout
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PayPal
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PaySwarm

paymentMethodId.c: An identifier for the method of payment used (e.g. the last 4 digits of the credit card).

PaymentPastDue.c: The payment is due and considered late.

PaymentService.c: A Service to transfer funds from a person or organization to a beneficiary person or organization.

paymentStatus.c: The status of payment; whether the invoice has been paid or not.

PaymentStatusType.c: A specific payment status. For example, PaymentDue, PaymentComplete, etc.

paymentUrl.c: The URL for sending a payment.

PeopleAudience.c: A set of characteristics belonging to people, e.g. who compose an item's target audience.

PerformAction.c: The act of participating in performance arts.

PerformanceRole.c: A PerformanceRole is a Role that some entity places with regard to a theatrical performance, e.g. in a Movie, TVSeries etc.

performer.c: A performer at the event—for example, a presenter, musician, musical group or actor.

performerIn.c: Event that this person is a performer or participant in.

performers.c: The main performer or performers of the event—for example, a presenter, musician, or actor.

PerformingArtsTheater.c: A theater or other performing art center.

PerformingGroup.c: A performance group, such as a band, an orchestra, or a circus.

performTime.c: The length of time it takes to perform instructions or a direction (not including time to prepare the supplies), in ISO 8601 duration format.

Periodical.c:
A publication in any medium issued in successive parts bearing numerical or chronological designations and intended, such as a magazine, scholarly journal, or newspaper to continue indefinitely.

See also blog post.

permissions.c: Permission(s) required to run the app (for example, a mobile app may require full internet access or may run only on wifi).

permissionType.c: The type of permission granted the person, organization, or audience.

Permit.c: A permit issued by an organization, e.g. a parking pass.

permitAudience.c: The target audience for this permit.

permittedUsage.c: Indications regarding the permitted usage of the accommodation.

Person.c: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).

petsAllowed.c: Indicates whether pets are allowed to enter the accommodation or lodging business. More detailed information can be put in a text value.

PhotographAction.c: The act of capturing still images of objects using a camera.

pickupLocation.c: Where a taxi will pick up a passenger or a rental car can be picked up.

pickupTime.c: When a taxi will pickup a passenger or a rental car can be picked up.

Place.c: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

PlaceOfWorship.c: Place of worship, such as a church, synagogue, or mosque.

PlanAction.c: The act of planning the execution of an event/task/action/reservation/plan to a future date.

PlayAction.c:
The act of playing/exercising/training/performing for enjoyment, leisure, recreation, Competition or exercise.

Related actions:

  • ListenAction: Unlike ListenAction (which is under ConsumeAction), PlayAction refers to performing for an audience or at an event, rather than consuming music.
  • WatchAction: Unlike WatchAction (which is under ConsumeAction), PlayAction refers to showing/displaying for an audience or at an event, rather than consuming visual content.

playersOnline.c: Number of players on the server.

playerType.c: Player type required—for example, Flash or Silverlight.

playMode.c: Indicates whether this game is multi-player, co-op or single-player.  The game can be marked as multi-player, co-op and single-player at the same time.

polygon.c: A polygon is the area enclosed by a point-to-point path for which the starting and ending points are the same. A polygon is expressed as a series of four or more space delimited points where the first and final points are identical.

position.c: The position of an item in a series or sequence of items.

postOfficeBoxNumber.c: The post office box number for PO box addresses.

potentialAction.c: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

PotentialActionStatus.c: A description of an action that is supported.

predecessorOf.c: A pointer from a previous, often discontinued variant of the product to its newer variant.

PreOrder.c: Indicates that the item is available for pre-order, but will be delivered when generally available.

PrependAction.c: The act of inserting at the beginning if an ordered collection.

prepTime.c: The length of time it takes to prepare the items to be used in instructions or a direction, in ISO 8601 duration format.

PreSale.c: Indicates that the item is available for ordering and delivery before general availability.

PresentationDigitalDocument.c: A file containing slides or used for a presentation.

previousItem.c: A link to the ListItem that preceeds the current one.

previousStartDate.c: Used in conjunction with eventStatus for rescheduled or cancelled events. This property contains the previously scheduled start date. For rescheduled events, the startDate property should be used for the newly scheduled start date. In the (rare) case of an event that has been postponed and rescheduled multiple times, this field may be repeated.

price.c:
The offer price of a product, or of a price component when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.

Usage guidelines:

  • Use the priceCurrency property (with ISO 4217 codes e.g. "USD") instead of including ambiguous symbols such as '$' in the value.
  • Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.
  • Note that both RDFa and Microdata syntax allow the use of a "content=" attribute for publishing simple machine-readable values alongside more human-friendly formatting.
  • Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similiar Unicode symbols.

priceComponent.c: This property links to all UnitPriceSpecification nodes that apply in parallel for the CompoundPriceSpecification node.

priceCurrency.c: The currency (in 3-letter ISO 4217 format) of the price or a price component, when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.

priceRange.c: The price range of the business, for example $$$.

priceSpecification.c: One or more detailed price specifications, indicating the unit price and delivery or payment charges.

PriceSpecification.c: A structured value representing a price or price range. Typically, only the subclasses of this type are used for markup. It is recommended to use MonetaryAmount to describe independent amounts of money such as a salary, credit card limits, etc.

priceType.c: A short text or acronym indicating multiple price specifications for the same offer, e.g. SRP for the suggested retail price or INVOICE for the invoice price, mostly used in the car industry.

priceValidUntil.c: The date after which the price is no longer available.

primaryImageOfPage.c: Indicates the main image on the page.

printColumn.c: The number of the column in which the NewsArticle appears in the print edition.

printEdition.c: The edition of the print product in which the NewsArticle appears.

printPage.c: If this NewsArticle appears in print, this field indicates the name of the page on which the article is found. Please note that this field is intended for the exact page name (e.g. A5, B18).

printSection.c: If this NewsArticle appears in print, this field indicates the print section in which the article appeared.

processingTime.c: Estimated processing time for the service using this channel.

processorRequirements.c: Processor architecture required to run the application (e.g. IA64).

producer.c: The person or organization who produced the work (e.g. music album, movie, tv/radio series etc.).

produces.c: The tangible thing generated by the service, e.g. a passport, permit, etc.

Product.c: Any offered product or service. For example: a pair of shoes; a concert ticket; the rental of a car; a haircut; or an episode of a TV show streamed online.

productID.c: The product identifier, such as ISBN. For example: meta itemprop="productID" content="isbn:123-456-789".

productionCompany.c: The production company or studio responsible for the item e.g. series, video game, episode etc.

productionDate.c: The date of production of the item, e.g. vehicle.

ProductModel.c: A datasheet or vendor specification of a product (in the sense of a prototypical description).

productSupported.c: The product or service this support contact point is related to (such as product support for a particular product line). This can be a specific product or product line (e.g. "iPhone") or a general category of products or services (e.g. "smartphones").

ProfessionalService.c:
Original definition: "provider of professional services."

The general ProfessionalService type for local businesses was deprecated due to confusion with Service. For reference, the types that it included were: Dentist, AccountingService, Attorney, Notary, as well as types for several kinds of HomeAndConstructionBusiness: Electrician, GeneralContractor, HousePainter, Locksmith, Plumber, RoofingContractor. LegalService was introduced as a more inclusive supertype of Attorney.

proficiencyLevel.c: Proficiency needed for this content; expected values: 'Beginner', 'Expert'.

ProgramMembership.c: Used to describe membership in a loyalty programs (e.g. "StarAliance"), traveler clubs (e.g. "AAA"), purchase clubs ("Safeway Club"), etc.

programMembershipUsed.c: Any membership in a frequent flyer, hotel loyalty program, etc. being applied to the reservation.

programmingModel.c: Indicates whether API is managed or unmanaged.

propertyID.c:
A commonly used identifier for the characteristic represented by the property, e.g. a manufacturer or a standard code for a property. propertyID can be
(1) a prefixed string, mainly meant to be used with standards for product properties; (2) a site-specific, non-prefixed string (e.g. the primary key of the property or the vendor-specific id of the property), or (3)
a URL indicating the type of the property, either pointing to an external vocabulary, or a Web resource that describes the property (e.g. a glossary entry).
Standards bodies should promote a standard prefix for the identifiers of properties from their standards.

PropertyValue.c:
A property-value pair, e.g. representing a feature of a product or place. Use the 'name' property for the name of the property. If there is an additional human-readable version of the value, put that into the 'description' property.

Always use specific schema.org properties when a) they exist and b) you can populate them. Using PropertyValue as a substitute will typically not trigger the same effect as using the original, specific property.

proteinContent.c: The number of grams of protein.

provider.c: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

providerMobility.c: Indicates the mobility of a provided service (e.g. 'static', 'dynamic').

providesBroadcastService.c: The BroadcastService offered on this channel.

providesService.c: The service provided by this channel.

publicAccess.c: A flag to signal that the Place is open to public visitors. If this property is omitted there is no assumed default boolean value

publication.c: A publication event associated with the item.

PublicationEvent.c: A PublicationEvent corresponds indifferently to the event of publication for a CreativeWork of any type e.g. a broadcast event, an on-demand event, a book/journal publication via a variety of delivery media.

PublicationIssue.c:
A part of a successively published publication such as a periodical or publication volume, often numbered, usually containing a grouping of works such as articles.

blog post.

PublicationVolume.c:
A part of a successively published publication such as a periodical or multi-volume work, often numbered. It may represent a time span, such as a year.

  <br/><br/>See also <a href="http://blog.schema.org/2014/09/schemaorg-support-for-bibliographic_2.html">blog post</a>.

PublicHolidays.c: This stands for any day that is a public holiday; it is a placeholder for all official public holidays in some particular location. While not technically a "day of the week", it can be used with OpeningHoursSpecification. In the context of an opening hours specification it can be used to indicate opening hours on public holidays, overriding general opening hours for the day of the week on which a public holiday occurs.

publishedOn.c: A broadcast service associated with the publication event.

publisher.c: The publisher of the creative work.

publishingPrinciples.c:
The publishingPrinciples property indicates (typically via URL) a document describing the editorial principles of an Organization (or individual e.g. a Person writing a blog) that relate to their activities as a publisher, e.g. ethics or diversity policies. When applied to a CreativeWork (e.g. NewsArticle) the principles are those of the party primarily responsible for the creation of the CreativeWork.

While such policies are most typically expressed in natural language, sometimes related information (e.g. indicating a funder) can be expressed using schema.org terminology.

purchaseDate.c: The date the item e.g. vehicle was purchased by the current owner.

QAPage.c: A QAPage is a WebPage focussed on a specific Question and its Answer(s), e.g. in a question answering site or documenting Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs).

qualifications.c: Specific qualifications required for this role.

QualitativeValue.c: A predefined value for a product characteristic, e.g. the power cord plug type 'US' or the garment sizes 'S', 'M', 'L', and 'XL'.

QuantitativeValue.c: A point value or interval for product characteristics and other purposes.

Quantity.c: Quantities such as distance, time, mass, weight, etc. Particular instances of say Mass are entities like '3 Kg' or '4 milligrams'.

query.c: A sub property of instrument. The query used on this action.

quest.c: The task that a player-controlled character, or group of characters may complete in order to gain a reward.

question.c: A sub property of object. A question.

Question.c: A specific question - e.g. from a user seeking answers online, or collected in a Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) document.

QuoteAction.c: An agent quotes/estimates/appraises an object/product/service with a price at a location/store.

RadioChannel.c: A unique instance of a radio BroadcastService on a CableOrSatelliteService lineup.

RadioClip.c: A short radio program or a segment/part of a radio program.

RadioEpisode.c: A radio episode which can be part of a series or season.

RadioSeason.c: Season dedicated to radio broadcast and associated online delivery.

RadioSeries.c: CreativeWorkSeries dedicated to radio broadcast and associated online delivery.

Rating.c: A rating is an evaluation on a numeric scale, such as 1 to 5 stars.

ratingCount.c: The count of total number of ratings.

ReactAction.c: The act of responding instinctively and emotionally to an object, expressing a sentiment.

ReadAction.c: The act of consuming written content.

readonlyValue.c: Whether or not a property is mutable.  Default is false. Specifying this for a property that also has a value makes it act similar to a "hidden" input in an HTML form.

ReadPermission.c: Permission to read or view the document.

realEstateAgent.c: A sub property of participant. The real estate agent involved in the action.

RearWheelDriveConfiguration.c: Real-wheel drive is a transmission layout where the engine drives the rear wheels.

ReceiveAction.c:
The act of physically/electronically taking delivery of an object thathas been transferred from an origin to a destination. Reciprocal of SendAction.

Related actions:

  • SendAction: The reciprocal of ReceiveAction.
  • TakeAction: Unlike TakeAction, ReceiveAction does not imply that the ownership has been transfered (e.g. I can receive a package, but it does not mean the package is now mine).

recipe.c: A sub property of instrument. The recipe/instructions used to perform the action.

Recipe.c: A recipe. For dietary restrictions covered by the recipe, a few common restrictions are enumerated via suitableForDiet. The keywords property can also be used to add more detail.

recipeCategory.c: The category of the recipefor example, appetizer, entree, etc.

recipeCuisine.c: The cuisine of the recipe (for example, French or Ethiopian).

recipeIngredient.c: A single ingredient used in the recipe, e.g. sugar, flour or garlic.

recipeInstructions.c: A step in making the recipe, in the form of a single item (document, video, etc.) or an ordered list with HowToStep and/or HowToSection items.

recipeYield.c: The quantity produced by the recipe (for example, number of people served, number of servings, etc).

recipient.c: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.

recordedAs.c: An audio recording of the work.

recordedAt.c: The Event where the CreativeWork was recorded. The CreativeWork may capture all or part of the event.

recordedIn.c: The CreativeWork that captured all or part of this Event.

recordingOf.c: The composition this track is a recording of.

recordLabel.c: The label that issued the release.

referenceQuantity.c: The reference quantity for which a certain price applies, e.g. 1 EUR per 4 kWh of electricity. This property is a replacement for unitOfMeasurement for the advanced cases where the price does not relate to a standard unit.

referencesOrder.c: The Order(s) related to this Invoice. One or more Orders may be combined into a single Invoice.

RefurbishedCondition.c: Indicates that the item is refurbished.

regionsAllowed.c: The regions where the media is allowed. If not specified, then it's assumed to be allowed everywhere. Specify the countries in ISO 3166 format.

RegisterAction.c:
The act of registering to be a user of a service, product or web page.

Related actions:

  • JoinAction: Unlike JoinAction, RegisterAction implies you are registering to be a user of a service, not a group/team of people.
  • [FollowAction]]: Unlike FollowAction, RegisterAction doesn't imply that the agent is expecting to poll for updates from the object.
  • SubscribeAction: Unlike SubscribeAction, RegisterAction doesn't imply that the agent is expecting updates from the object.

RejectAction.c:
The act of rejecting to/adopting an object.

Related actions:

  • AcceptAction: The antonym of RejectAction.

relatedLink.c: A link related to this web page, for example to other related web pages.

releaseDate.c: The release date of a product or product model. This can be used to distinguish the exact variant of a product.

releasedEvent.c: The place and time the release was issued, expressed as a PublicationEvent.

releaseNotes.c: Description of what changed in this version.

releaseOf.c: The album this is a release of.

remainingAttendeeCapacity.c: The number of attendee places for an event that remain unallocated.

RentAction.c: The act of giving money in return for temporary use, but not ownership, of an object such as a vehicle or property. For example, an agent rents a property from a landlord in exchange for a periodic payment.

RentalCarReservation.c:
A reservation for a rental car.

Note: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations.

ReplaceAction.c: The act of editing a recipient by replacing an old object with a new object.

replacee.c: A sub property of object. The object that is being replaced.

replacer.c: A sub property of object. The object that replaces.

ReplyAction.c:
The act of responding to a question/message asked/sent by the object. Related to AskAction

Related actions:

  • AskAction: Appears generally as an origin of a ReplyAction.

replyToUrl.c: The URL at which a reply may be posted to the specified UserComment.

Report.c: A Report generated by governmental or non-governmental organization.

reportNumber.c: The number or other unique designator assigned to a Report by the publishing organization.

representativeOfPage.c: Indicates whether this image is representative of the content of the page.

requiredCollateral.c: Assets required to secure loan or credit repayments. It may take form of third party pledge, goods, financial instruments (cash, securities, etc.)

requiredGender.c: Audiences defined by a person's gender.

requiredMaxAge.c: Audiences defined by a person's maximum age.

requiredMinAge.c: Audiences defined by a person's minimum age.

requiredQuantity.c: The required quantity of the item(s).

requirements.c: Component dependency requirements for application. This includes runtime environments and shared libraries that are not included in the application distribution package, but required to run the application (Examples: DirectX, Java or .NET runtime).

requiresSubscription.c: Indicates if use of the media require a subscription (either paid or free). Allowed values are true or false (note that an earlier version had 'yes', 'no').

Reservation.c:
Describes a reservation for travel, dining or an event. Some reservations require tickets.

Note: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, restaurant reservations, flights, or rental cars, use Offer.

ReservationCancelled.c: The status for a previously confirmed reservation that is now cancelled.

ReservationConfirmed.c: The status of a confirmed reservation.

reservationFor.c: The thing -- flight, event, restaurant,etc. being reserved.

ReservationHold.c: The status of a reservation on hold pending an update like credit card number or flight changes.

reservationId.c: A unique identifier for the reservation.

ReservationPackage.c: A group of multiple reservations with common values for all sub-reservations.

ReservationPending.c: The status of a reservation when a request has been sent, but not confirmed.

reservationStatus.c: The current status of the reservation.

ReserveAction.c:
Reserving a concrete object.

Related actions:

  • ScheduleAction: Unlike ScheduleAction, ReserveAction reserves concrete objects (e.g. a table, a hotel) towards a time slot / spatial allocation.

reservedTicket.c: A ticket associated with the reservation.

Reservoir.c: A reservoir of water, typically an artificially created lake, like the Lake Kariba reservoir.

Residence.c: The place where a person lives.

Resort.c:
A resort is a place used for relaxation or recreation, attracting visitors for holidays or vacations. Resorts are places, towns or sometimes commercial establishment operated by a single company (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Resort).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

RestrictedDiet.c: A diet restricted to certain foods or preparations for cultural, religious, health or lifestyle reasons.

result.c: The result produced in the action. e.g. John wrote a book.

resultComment.c: A sub property of result. The Comment created or sent as a result of this action.

resultReview.c: A sub property of result. The review that resulted in the performing of the action.

ResumeAction.c: The act of resuming a device or application which was formerly paused (e.g. resume music playback or resume a timer).

ReturnAction.c: The act of returning to the origin that which was previously received (concrete objects) or taken (ownership).

Review.c: A review of an item - for example, of a restaurant, movie, or store.

ReviewAction.c: The act of producing a balanced opinion about the object for an audience. An agent reviews an object with participants resulting in a review.

reviewBody.c: The actual body of the review.

reviewCount.c: The count of total number of reviews.

reviewedBy.c: People or organizations that have reviewed the content on this web page for accuracy and/or completeness.

reviewRating.c: The rating given in this review. Note that reviews can themselves be rated. The reviewRating applies to rating given by the review. The aggregateRating property applies to the review itself, as a creative work.

RightHandDriving.c: The steering position is on the right side of the vehicle (viewed from the main direction of driving).

RiverBodyOfWater.c: A river (for example, the broad majestic Shannon).

Role.c:
Represents additional information about a relationship or property. For example a Role can be used to say that a 'member' role linking some SportsTeam to a player occurred during a particular time period. Or that a Person's 'actor' role in a Movie was for some particular characterName. Such properties can be attached to a Role entity, which is then associated with the main entities using ordinary properties like 'member' or 'actor'.

See also blog post.

roleName.c: A role played, performed or filled by a person or organization. For example, the team of creators for a comic book might fill the roles named 'inker', 'penciller', and 'letterer'; or an athlete in a SportsTeam might play in the position named 'Quarterback'.

Room.c:
A room is a distinguishable space within a structure, usually separated from other spaces by interior walls. (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Room).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

RsvpAction.c: The act of notifying an event organizer as to whether you expect to attend the event.

rsvpResponse.c: The response (yes, no, maybe) to the RSVP.

RsvpResponseMaybe.c: The invitee may or may not attend.

RsvpResponseType.c: RsvpResponseType is an enumeration type whose instances represent responding to an RSVP request.

runtime.c: Runtime platform or script interpreter dependencies (Example - Java v1, Python2.3, .Net Framework 3.0).

runtimePlatform.c: Runtime platform or script interpreter dependencies (Example - Java v1, Python2.3, .Net Framework 3.0).

RVPark.c: A place offering space for "Recreational Vehicles", Caravans, mobile homes and the like.

salaryCurrency.c: The currency (coded using ISO 4217 ) used for the main salary information in this job posting or for this employee.

sameAs.c: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.

sampleType.c: What type of code sample: full (compile ready) solution, code snippet, inline code, scripts, template.

saturatedFatContent.c: The number of grams of saturated fat.

Saturday.c: The day of the week between Friday and Sunday.

ScheduleAction.c:
Scheduling future actions, events, or tasks.

Related actions:

  • ReserveAction: Unlike ReserveAction, ScheduleAction allocates future actions (e.g. an event, a task, etc) towards a time slot / spatial allocation.

scheduledPaymentDate.c: The date the invoice is scheduled to be paid.

scheduledTime.c: The time the object is scheduled to.

schemaVersion.c: Indicates (by URL or string) a particular version of a schema used in some CreativeWork. For example, a document could declare a schemaVersion using an URL such as http://schema.org/version/2.0/ if precise indication of schema version was required by some application.

screenCount.c: The number of screens in the movie theater.

ScreeningEvent.c: A screening of a movie or other video.

screenshot.c: A link to a screenshot image of the app.

SeaBodyOfWater.c: A sea (for example, the Caspian sea).

SearchAction.c:
The act of searching for an object.

Related actions:

  • FindAction: SearchAction generally leads to a FindAction, but not necessarily.

SearchResultsPage.c: Web page type: Search results page.

season.c: A season in a media series.

Season.c: A media season e.g. tv, radio, video game etc.

seasonNumber.c: Position of the season within an ordered group of seasons.

seasons.c: A season in a media series.

Seat.c: Used to describe a seat, such as a reserved seat in an event reservation.

seatNumber.c: The location of the reserved seat (e.g., 27).

seatRow.c: The row location of the reserved seat (e.g., B).

seatSection.c: The section location of the reserved seat (e.g. Orchestra).

securityScreening.c: The type of security screening the passenger is subject to.

seeks.c: A pointer to products or services sought by the organization or person (demand).

SellAction.c: The act of taking money from a buyer in exchange for goods or services rendered. An agent sells an object, product, or service to a buyer for a price. Reciprocal of BuyAction.

seller.c: An entity which offers (sells / leases / lends / loans) the services / goods.  A seller may also be a provider.

SendAction.c:
The act of physically/electronically dispatching an object for transfer from an origin to a destination.Related actions:

  • ReceiveAction: The reciprocal of SendAction.
  • GiveAction: Unlike GiveAction, SendAction does not imply the transfer of ownership (e.g. I can send you my laptop, but I'm not necessarily giving it to you).

sender.c: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the sending end of the action.

serialNumber.c: The serial number or any alphanumeric identifier of a particular product. When attached to an offer, it is a shortcut for the serial number of the product included in the offer.

Series.c: A Series in schema.org is a group of related items, typically but not necessarily of the same kind.

Service.c: A service provided by an organization, e.g. delivery service, print services, etc.

serviceArea.c: The geographic area where the service is provided.

serviceAudience.c: The audience eligible for this service.

ServiceChannel.c: A means for accessing a service, e.g. a government office location, web site, or phone number.

serviceLocation.c: The location (e.g. civic structure, local business, etc.) where a person can go to access the service.

serviceOperator.c: The operating organization, if different from the provider.  This enables the representation of services that are provided by an organization, but operated by another organization like a subcontractor.

serviceOutput.c: The tangible thing generated by the service, e.g. a passport, permit, etc.

servicePhone.c: The phone number to use to access the service.

servicePostalAddress.c: The address for accessing the service by mail.

serviceSmsNumber.c: The number to access the service by text message.

serviceType.c: The type of service being offered, e.g. veterans' benefits, emergency relief, etc.

serviceUrl.c: The website to access the service.

servingSize.c: The serving size, in terms of the number of volume or mass.

ShareAction.c: The act of distributing content to people for their amusement or edification.

sharedContent.c: A CreativeWork such as an image, video, or audio clip shared as part of this posting.

significantLink.c: One of the more significant URLs on the page. Typically, these are the non-navigation links that are clicked on the most.

significantLinks.c: The most significant URLs on the page. Typically, these are the non-navigation links that are clicked on the most.

SinglePlayer.c: Play mode: SinglePlayer. Which is played by a lone player.

SiteNavigationElement.c: A navigation element of the page.

skills.c: Skills required to fulfill this role.

sku.c: The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU), i.e. a merchant-specific identifier for a product or service, or the product to which the offer refers.

smokingAllowed.c: Indicates whether it is allowed to smoke in the place, e.g. in the restaurant, hotel or hotel room.

SocialMediaPosting.c: A post to a social media platform, including blog posts, tweets, Facebook posts, etc.

sodiumContent.c: The number of milligrams of sodium.

softwareAddOn.c: Additional content for a software application.

softwareRequirements.c: Component dependency requirements for application. This includes runtime environments and shared libraries that are not included in the application distribution package, but required to run the application (Examples: DirectX, Java or .NET runtime).

SoftwareSourceCode.c: Computer programming source code. Example: Full (compile ready) solutions, code snippet samples, scripts, templates.

SoldOut.c: Indicates that the item has sold out.

SomeProducts.c: A placeholder for multiple similar products of the same kind.

sourceOrganization.c: The Organization on whose behalf the creator was working.

spatial.c: The range of spatial applicability of a dataset, e.g. for a dataset of New York weather, the state of New York.

spatialCoverage.c:
The spatialCoverage of a CreativeWork indicates the place(s) which are the focus of the content. It is a subproperty of
      contentLocation intended primarily for more technical and detailed materials. For example with a Dataset, it indicates
      areas that the dataset describes: a dataset of New York weather would have spatialCoverage which was the place: the state of New York.

specialCommitments.c: Any special commitments associated with this job posting. Valid entries include VeteranCommit, MilitarySpouseCommit, etc.

specialOpeningHoursSpecification.c:
The special opening hours of a certain place.

Use this to explicitly override general opening hours brought in scope by openingHoursSpecification or openingHours.

specialty.c: One of the domain specialities to which this web page's content applies.

Specialty.c: Any branch of a field in which people typically develop specific expertise, usually after significant study, time, and effort.

sponsor.c: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. e.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.

sportsActivityLocation.c: A sub property of location. The sports activity location where this action occurred.

SportsActivityLocation.c: A sports location, such as a playing field.

sportsEvent.c: A sub property of location. The sports event where this action occurred.

SportsOrganization.c: Represents the collection of all sports organizations, including sports teams, governing bodies, and sports associations.

sportsTeam.c: A sub property of participant. The sports team that participated on this action.

starRating.c: An official rating for a lodging business or food establishment, e.g. from national associations or standards bodies. Use the author property to indicate the rating organization, e.g. as an Organization with name such as (e.g. HOTREC, DEHOGA, WHR, or Hotelstars).

startDate.c: The start date and time of the item (in ISO 8601 date format).

startTime.c:
The startTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to start. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. e.g. John wrote a book from January to December.

Note that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

State.c: A state or province of a country.

steeringPosition.c: The position of the steering wheel or similar device (mostly for cars).

SteeringPositionValue.c: A value indicating a steering position.

steps.c: The steps in the form of a single item (text, document, video, etc.) or an ordered list with HowToStep and/or HowToSection items.

stepValue.c: The stepValue attribute indicates the granularity that is expected (and required) of the value in a PropertyValueSpecification.

streetAddress.c: The street address. For example, 1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy.

StructuredValue.c: Structured values are used when the value of a property has a more complex structure than simply being a textual value or a reference to another thing.

subEvent.c: An Event that is part of this event. For example, a conference event includes many presentations, each of which is a subEvent of the conference.

subEvents.c: Events that are a part of this event. For example, a conference event includes many presentations, each subEvents of the conference.

subOrganization.c: A relationship between two organizations where the first includes the second, e.g., as a subsidiary. See also: the more specific 'department' property.

subReservation.c: The individual reservations included in the package. Typically a repeated property.

SubscribeAction.c:
The act of forming a personal connection with someone/something (object) unidirectionally/asymmetrically to get updates pushed to.

Related actions:

  • FollowAction: Unlike FollowAction, SubscribeAction implies that the subscriber acts as a passive agent being constantly/actively pushed for updates.
  • RegisterAction: Unlike RegisterAction, SubscribeAction implies that the agent is interested in continuing receiving updates from the object.
  • JoinAction: Unlike JoinAction, SubscribeAction implies that the agent is interested in continuing receiving updates from the object.

subtitleLanguage.c: Languages in which subtitles/captions are available, in IETF BCP 47 standard format.

successorOf.c: A pointer from a newer variant of a product  to its previous, often discontinued predecessor.

sugarContent.c: The number of grams of sugar.

suggestedAnswer.c: An answer (possibly one of several, possibly incorrect) to a Question, e.g. on a Question/Answer site.

suggestedGender.c: The gender of the person or audience.

suggestedMaxAge.c: Maximal age recommended for viewing content.

suggestedMinAge.c: Minimal age recommended for viewing content.

suitableForDiet.c: Indicates a dietary restriction or guideline for which this recipe or menu item is suitable, e.g. diabetic, halal etc.

Suite.c:
A suite in a hotel or other public accommodation, denotes a class of luxury accommodations, the key feature of which is multiple rooms (Source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suite_(hotel)).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

Sunday.c: The day of the week between Saturday and Monday.

superEvent.c: An event that this event is a part of. For example, a collection of individual music performances might each have a music festival as their superEvent.

supply.c: A sub-property of instrument. A supply consumed when performing instructions or a direction.

surface.c: A material used as a surface in some artwork, e.g. Canvas, Paper, Wood, Board, etc.

SuspendAction.c: The act of momentarily pausing a device or application (e.g. pause music playback or pause a timer).

Table.c: A table on a Web page.

TakeAction.c:
The act of gaining ownership of an object from an origin. Reciprocal of GiveAction.

Related actions:

  • GiveAction: The reciprocal of TakeAction.
  • ReceiveAction: Unlike ReceiveAction, TakeAction implies that ownership has been transfered.

target.c: Indicates a target EntryPoint for an Action.

targetCollection.c: A sub property of object. The collection target of the action.

targetDescription.c: The description of a node in an established educational framework.

targetName.c: The name of a node in an established educational framework.

targetPlatform.c: Type of app development: phone, Metro style, desktop, XBox, etc.

targetProduct.c: Target Operating System / Product to which the code applies.  If applies to several versions, just the product name can be used.

targetUrl.c: The URL of a node in an established educational framework.

taxID.c: The Tax / Fiscal ID of the organization or person, e.g. the TIN in the US or the CIF/NIF in Spain.

TaxiReservation.c:
A reservation for a taxi.

Note: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use Offer.

TaxiService.c: A service for a vehicle for hire with a driver for local travel. Fares are usually calculated based on distance traveled.

TechArticle.c: A technical article - Example: How-to (task) topics, step-by-step, procedural troubleshooting, specifications, etc.

TelevisionChannel.c: A unique instance of a television BroadcastService on a CableOrSatelliteService lineup.

temporal.c: The range of temporal applicability of a dataset, e.g. for a 2011 census dataset, the year 2011 (in ISO 8601 time interval format).

temporalCoverage.c: The temporalCoverage of a CreativeWork indicates the period that the content applies to, i.e. that it describes, either as a DateTime or as a textual string indicating a time period in ISO 8601 time interval format. In the case of a Dataset it will typically indicate the relevant time period in a precise notation (e.g. for a 2011 census dataset, the year 2011 would be written "2011/2012"). Other forms of content e.g. ScholarlyArticle, Book, TVSeries or TVEpisode may indicate their temporalCoverage in broader terms - textually or via well-known URL. Written works such as books may sometimes have precise temporal coverage too, e.g. a work set in 1939 - 1945 can be indicated in ISO 8601 interval format format via "1939/1945".

text.c: The textual content of this CreativeWork.

TextDigitalDocument.c: A file composed primarily of text.

TheaterGroup.c: A theater group or company, for example, the Royal Shakespeare Company or Druid Theatre.

Thing.c: The most generic type of item.

thumbnail.c: Thumbnail image for an image or video.

thumbnailUrl.c: A thumbnail image relevant to the Thing.

Thursday.c: The day of the week between Wednesday and Friday.

tickerSymbol.c: The exchange traded instrument associated with a Corporation object. The tickerSymbol is expressed as an exchange and an instrument name separated by a space character. For the exchange component of the tickerSymbol attribute, we reccommend using the controlled vocaulary of Market Identifier Codes (MIC) specified in ISO15022.

Ticket.c: Used to describe a ticket to an event, a flight, a bus ride, etc.

ticketedSeat.c: The seat associated with the ticket.

ticketNumber.c: The unique identifier for the ticket.

ticketToken.c: Reference to an asset (e.g., Barcode, QR code image or PDF) usable for entrance.

TieAction.c: The act of reaching a draw in a competitive activity.

Time.c: A point in time recurring on multiple days in the form hh:mm:ss[Z|(+|-)hh:mm] (see XML schema for details).

timeRequired.c: Approximate or typical time it takes to work with or through this learning resource for the typical intended target audience, e.g. 'P30M', 'P1H25M'.

TipAction.c: The act of giving money voluntarily to a beneficiary in recognition of services rendered.

TollFree.c: The associated telephone number is toll free.

toLocation.c: A sub property of location. The final location of the object or the agent after the action.

tool.c: A sub property of instrument. An object used (but not consumed) when performing instructions or a direction.

toRecipient.c: A sub property of recipient. The recipient who was directly sent the message.

totalPrice.c: The total price for the reservation or ticket, including applicable taxes, shipping, etc.

totalTime.c: The total time required to perform instructions or a direction (including time to prepare the supplies), in ISO 8601 duration format.

TouristAttraction.c: A tourist attraction. In principle any Thing can be a TouristAttraction, from a Mountain and LandmarksOrHistoricalBuildings to a LocalBusiness. This Type can be used on its own to describe a general TourstAttraction, or be used as an additionalType to add tourist attraction properties to any other type. (See examples below)

touristType.c: Attraction suitable for type(s) of tourist. eg. Children, visitors from a particular country, etc.

track.c: A music recording (track)—usually a single song. If an ItemList is given, the list should contain items of type MusicRecording.

TrackAction.c:
An agent tracks an object for updates.

Related actions:

  • FollowAction: Unlike FollowAction, TrackAction refers to the interest on the location of innanimates objects.
  • SubscribeAction: Unlike SubscribeAction, TrackAction refers to the interest on the location of innanimate objects.

trackingUrl.c: Tracking url for the parcel delivery.

tracks.c: A music recording (track)—usually a single song.

TradeAction.c: The act of participating in an exchange of goods and services for monetary compensation. An agent trades an object, product or service with a participant in exchange for a one time or periodic payment.

trailer.c: The trailer of a movie or tv/radio series, season, episode, etc.

trainName.c: The name of the train (e.g. The Orient Express).

trainNumber.c: The unique identifier for the train.

TrainReservation.c:
A reservation for train travel.

Note: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use Offer.

TrainTrip.c: A trip on a commercial train line.

transcript.c: If this MediaObject is an AudioObject or VideoObject, the transcript of that object.

transFatContent.c: The number of grams of trans fat.

TransferAction.c: The act of transferring/moving (abstract or concrete) animate or inanimate objects from one place to another.

translator.c: Organization or person who adapts a creative work to different languages, regional differences and technical requirements of a target market, or that translates during some event.

TravelAction.c: The act of traveling from an fromLocation to a destination by a specified mode of transport, optionally with participants.

Tuesday.c: The day of the week between Monday and Wednesday.

TVClip.c: A short TV program or a segment/part of a TV program.

TVEpisode.c: A TV episode which can be part of a series or season.

TVSeason.c: Season dedicated to TV broadcast and associated online delivery.

TVSeries.c: CreativeWorkSeries dedicated to TV broadcast and associated online delivery.

TypeAndQuantityNode.c: A structured value indicating the quantity, unit of measurement, and business function of goods included in a bundle offer.

typeOfBed.c: The type of bed to which the BedDetail refers, i.e. the type of bed available in the quantity indicated by quantity.

typeOfGood.c: The product that this structured value is referring to.

typicalAgeRange.c: The typical expected age range, e.g. '7-9', '11-'.

underName.c: The person or organization the reservation or ticket is for.

unitCode.c: The unit of measurement given using the UN/CEFACT Common Code (3 characters) or a URL. Other codes than the UN/CEFACT Common Code may be used with a prefix followed by a colon.

UnitPriceSpecification.c: The price asked for a given offer by the respective organization or person.

unitText.c: A string or text indicating the unit of measurement. Useful if you cannot provide a standard unit code for unitCode.

UnRegisterAction.c:
The act of un-registering from a service.

Related actions:

  • RegisterAction: antonym of UnRegisterAction.
  • Leave: Unlike LeaveAction, UnRegisterAction implies that you are unregistering from a service you werer previously registered, rather than leaving a team/group of people.

unsaturatedFatContent.c: The number of grams of unsaturated fat.

UpdateAction.c: The act of managing by changing/editing the state of the object.

uploadDate.c: Date when this media object was uploaded to this site.

upvoteCount.c: The number of upvotes this question, answer or comment has received from the community.

urlTemplate.c: An url template (RFC6570) that will be used to construct the target of the execution of the action.

UseAction.c: The act of applying an object to its intended purpose.

UsedCondition.c: Indicates that the item is used.

UserBlocks.c: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use Action-based vocabulary, alongside types such as Comment.

UserCheckins.c: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use Action-based vocabulary, alongside types such as Comment.

UserComments.c: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use Action-based vocabulary, alongside types such as Comment.

UserDownloads.c: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use Action-based vocabulary, alongside types such as Comment.

UserInteraction.c: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use Action-based vocabulary, alongside types such as Comment.

userInteractionCount.c: The number of interactions for the CreativeWork using the WebSite or SoftwareApplication.

UserLikes.c: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use Action-based vocabulary, alongside types such as Comment.

UserPageVisits.c: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use Action-based vocabulary, alongside types such as Comment.

UserPlays.c: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use Action-based vocabulary, alongside types such as Comment.

UserPlusOnes.c: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use Action-based vocabulary, alongside types such as Comment.

UserTweets.c: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use Action-based vocabulary, alongside types such as Comment.

validFor.c: The time validity of the permit.

validFrom.c: The date when the item becomes valid.

validIn.c: The geographic area where the permit is valid.

validThrough.c: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

validUntil.c: The date when the item is no longer valid.

value.c:
The value of the quantitative value or property value node.

  • For QuantitativeValue and MonetaryAmount, the recommended type for values is 'Number'.
  • For PropertyValue, it can be 'Text;', 'Number', 'Boolean', or 'StructuredValue'.

valueAddedTaxIncluded.c: Specifies whether the applicable value-added tax (VAT) is included in the price specification or not.

valueMaxLength.c: Specifies the allowed range for number of characters in a literal value.

valueMinLength.c: Specifies the minimum allowed range for number of characters in a literal value.

valueName.c: Indicates the name of the PropertyValueSpecification to be used in URL templates and form encoding in a manner analogous to HTML's input@name.

valuePattern.c: Specifies a regular expression for testing literal values according to the HTML spec.

valueReference.c: A pointer to a secondary value that provides additional information on the original value, e.g. a reference temperature.

valueRequired.c: Whether the property must be filled in to complete the action.  Default is false.

vatID.c: The Value-added Tax ID of the organization or person.

VeganDiet.c: A diet exclusive of all animal products.

VegetarianDiet.c: A diet exclusive of animal meat.

Vehicle.c: A vehicle is a device that is designed or used to transport people or cargo over land, water, air, or through space.

vehicleConfiguration.c: A short text indicating the configuration of the vehicle, e.g. '5dr hatchback ST 2.5 MT 225 hp' or 'limited edition'.

vehicleEngine.c: Information about the engine or engines of the vehicle.

vehicleIdentificationNumber.c: The Vehicle Identification Number (VIN) is a unique serial number used by the automotive industry to identify individual motor vehicles.

vehicleInteriorColor.c: The color or color combination of the interior of the vehicle.

vehicleInteriorType.c: The type or material of the interior of the vehicle (e.g. synthetic fabric, leather, wood, etc.). While most interior types are characterized by the material used, an interior type can also be based on vehicle usage or target audience.

vehicleModelDate.c: The release date of a vehicle model (often used to differentiate versions of the same make and model).

vehicleSeatingCapacity.c:
The number of passengers that can be seated in the vehicle, both in terms of the physical space available, and in terms of limitations set by law.

Typical unit code(s): C62 for persons.

vehicleSpecialUsage.c: Indicates whether the vehicle has been used for special purposes, like commercial rental, driving school, or as a taxi. The legislation in many countries requires this information to be revealed when offering a car for sale.

vehicleTransmission.c: The type of component used for transmitting the power from a rotating power source to the wheels or other relevant component(s) ("gearbox" for cars).

VenueMap.c: A venue map (e.g. for malls, auditoriums, museums, etc.).

version.c: The version of the CreativeWork embodied by a specified resource.

videoFormat.c: The type of screening or video broadcast used (e.g. IMAX, 3D, SD, HD, etc.).

videoFrameSize.c: The frame size of the video.

VideoGallery.c: Web page type: Video gallery page.

VideoGame.c: A video game is an electronic game that involves human interaction with a user interface to generate visual feedback on a video device.

VideoGameClip.c: A short segment/part of a video game.

ViewAction.c: The act of consuming static visual content.

VisualArtwork.c: A work of art that is primarily visual in character.

volumeNumber.c: Identifies the volume of publication or multi-part work; for example, "iii" or "2".

VoteAction.c: The act of expressing a preference from a fixed/finite/structured set of choices/options.

WantAction.c: The act of expressing a desire about the object. An agent wants an object.

warranty.c: The warranty promise(s) included in the offer.

warrantyPromise.c: The warranty promise(s) included in the offer.

WarrantyPromise.c: A structured value representing the duration and scope of services that will be provided to a customer free of charge in case of a defect or malfunction of a product.

warrantyScope.c: The scope of the warranty promise.

WarrantyScope.c:
A range of of services that will be provided to a customer free of charge in case of a defect or malfunction of a product.

Commonly used values:

  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Labor-BringIn
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PartsAndLabor-BringIn
  • http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PartsAndLabor-PickUp

WatchAction.c: The act of consuming dynamic/moving visual content.

WearAction.c: The act of dressing oneself in clothing.

webCheckinTime.c: The time when a passenger can check into the flight online.

WebPage.c: A web page. Every web page is implicitly assumed to be declared to be of type WebPage, so the various properties about that webpage, such as breadcrumb may be used. We recommend explicit declaration if these properties are specified, but if they are found outside of an itemscope, they will be assumed to be about the page.

WebPageElement.c: A web page element, like a table or an image.

WebSite.c: A WebSite is a set of related web pages and other items typically served from a single web domain and accessible via URLs.

Wednesday.c: The day of the week between Tuesday and Thursday.

weight.c: The weight of the product or person.

WinAction.c: The act of achieving victory in a competitive activity.

winner.c: A sub property of participant. The winner of the action.

wordCount.c: The number of words in the text of the Article.

workExample.c: Example/instance/realization/derivation of the concept of this creative work. eg. The paperback edition, first edition, or eBook.

workFeatured.c:
A work featured in some event, e.g. exhibited in an ExhibitionEvent.
       Specific subproperties are available for workPerformed (e.g. a play), or a workPresented (a Movie at a ScreeningEvent).

workHours.c: The typical working hours for this job (e.g. 1st shift, night shift, 8am-5pm).

workLocation.c: A contact location for a person's place of work.

workPerformed.c: A work performed in some event, for example a play performed in a TheaterEvent.

workPresented.c: The movie presented during this event.

worksFor.c: Organizations that the person works for.

worstRating.c: The lowest value allowed in this rating system. If worstRating is omitted, 1 is assumed.

WPAdBlock.c: An advertising section of the page.

WPFooter.c: The footer section of the page.

WPHeader.c: The header section of the page.

WPSideBar.c: A sidebar section of the page.

WriteAction.c: The act of authoring written creative content.

WritePermission.c: Permission to write or edit the document.

yearlyRevenue.c: The size of the business in annual revenue.

yield.c: The quantity that results by performing instructions. For example, a paper airplane, 10 personalized candles.

ZoneBoardingPolicy.c: The airline boards by zones of the plane.
